title: smart forensic eveidence analysis system
description:
The Smart Forensic Evidence Analysis System is an AI-driven web platform designed to assist law enforcement and defense agencies in analyzing and managing digital crime evidence. The system collects and processes multi-format evidence such as images, videos, documents, and audio recordings using advanced AI/ML models to automatically detect clues, identify suspects, and establish connections between multiple cases.

A key innovation of this system is the Person Monitoring and Sighting Report Feature, which continuously tracks and reports the presence of specific individuals across public surveillance cameras. Using facial recognition and re-identification algorithms, the system generates detailed reports showing when and where a person was spotted, along with timestamps, location details, and confidence levels. This assists authorities in tracing movements and identifying potential suspects in real time.

The platform ensures data security and legal compliance through role-based access, encryption, and ethical AI practices. It also includes a chatbot-based investigation assistant that answers queries like ‚ÄúFind all evidence linking suspect X to case Y‚Äù or ‚ÄúShow sightings of person A this week.‚Äù
additionalNotes:
The **Smart Forensic Evidence Analysis System** website follows a **dark intelligence theme**, designed to reflect the seriousness, precision, and technological depth of modern crime investigation. The overall layout uses deep navy and charcoal backgrounds with neon blue and red accents to create a professional and high-tech command center atmosphere. The interface is built around clarity and usability for investigators, featuring glass-like panels, glowing highlights, and subtle animations that give a futuristic, AI-powered feel.

The homepage presents a bold title with a sleek radar or network animation in the background, symbolizing digital surveillance and analysis. Users can quickly upload evidence, view ongoing cases, or initiate AI-based investigations from this central dashboard. Evidence is displayed as interactive cards categorized by type‚Äîimages, videos, audio, or documents‚Äîwith status indicators like ‚ÄúIn Review‚Äù or ‚ÄúVerified.‚Äù

A dedicated **Person Monitoring Dashboard** displays live camera feeds, a map pinpointing recent sightings, and a timeline showing when and where specific individuals were identified. The interface integrates real-time alerts and report generation features to assist law enforcement in tracking suspects efficiently. An AI-powered chatbot sits discreetly in the corner, offering instant query assistance, such as retrieving evidence details or cross-referencing case data.

With its dark aesthetic, glowing interface elements, and modern glassmorphic design, the website visually conveys intelligence, authority, and security‚Äîperfectly suited for a digital forensics platform that empowers police and defense officials to use AI for smarter, faster, and more accurate crime investigation.

title: waste product buying website
description:
üå± Project Prompt: Waste Buy & Sell Website

Build a full website using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript with the following pages and unique UI/UX ideas:

1. Landing Page (Homepage)

Hero banner with split layout:

Left side ‚Üí Headline ‚ÄúTurn Waste into Wealth‚Äù + CTA buttons (Sell Waste, Buy Waste).

Right side ‚Üí Animated recycling bin illustration (CSS/JS animation).

Floating circular category icons (Plastic, Paper, Metal, E-Waste) with hover animations.

Live counter section: ‚Äú20,000+ KG waste recycled | 5000+ CO‚ÇÇ saved‚Äù.

Drag & Drop interaction ‚Üí drag an item (icon) into a bin to show estimated value popup.

2. Selling Page (Waste Seller Portal)

Upload waste image.

Choose category (dropdown).

Enter weight (slider).

Get real-time price estimate.

Confirm listing.

Progress bar showing form completion.

AI-like feature: auto-suggest category based on uploaded image (simulated with JS).

3. Buy Page (Marketplace)

Smart filters (category, location, weight, price).

Hover effects on cards ‚Üí show seller info + ‚ÄúAdd to Cart.‚Äù

4. Pricing & Subscription Page

Animated toggle: Monthly ‚Üî Yearly pricing.

Comparison table with animated checkmarks.

5. Logistics & Pickup Services Page

Booking form with date & time picker + weight slider.

Live tracking widget (like delivery tracking bar).

General Design Requirements

üëâ Use this prompt to generate a multi-page project skeleton where:

Each page has its own HTML file (index.html, sell.html, buy.html, pricing.html, logistics.html).

Common styles go in style.css.

Interactivity (counters, drag-drop, sliders, animations) go in script.js.

title: timing based reminder
description:
*Situation*
Users need a smart location-based reminder system that automatically triggers notifications for specific tasks when entering or leaving designated rooms within a personal living space.

*Task*
The assistant should design a comprehensive location-based reminder application that:
- Captures user-defined indoor locations (kitchen, bedroom closet, home office)
- Generates context-specific task reminders
- Triggers precise notifications upon entering or exiting predefined geographical boundaries

*Objective*
Create an intuitive mobile application that enhances personal productivity by providing timely, location-sensitive reminders for specific household tasks with minimal user intervention.

*Knowledge*
- GPS tracking must be precise within indoor environments
- Reminders are task-specific: 
  1. Grab laptop
  2. Take out trash
- Application requires permissions for indoor location services
- Locations are limited to specific rooms: 
  - Kitchen
  - Bedroom closet
  - Home office
- Notification triggers include both entry and exit events for each defined space

*Core Behavioral Rules*
1. The assistant should design a user-friendly interface for location and task reminder management
2. Implement precise indoor geofencing technology with minimal battery consumption
3. Provide clear, actionable notifications specific to each room's task
4. Ensure user privacy and explicit consent for indoor location tracking
5. Support multiple room-specific reminder configurations

*Technical Implementation Guidelines*
- Use smartphone's native GPS and indoor positioning services
- Implement background location monitoring for specific rooms
- Create lightweight, room-specific notification mechanism
- Support manual and automatic room location tagging
- Enable task reminder customization with text and priority options

*User Experience Principles*
- Minimize battery drain through intelligent indoor tracking
- Provide transparent location permission controls
- Allow easy addition/removal of room-specific task reminders
- Support both manual and automatic reminder generation

*Error Handling*
- Gracefully manage indoor GPS signal interruptions
- Provide clear user guidance for room location permission settings
- Implement fallback notification mechanisms
- Offer manual override for room-based task reminders

*Privacy Considerations*
- Anonymize indoor location data
- Allow complete indoor location tracking opt-out
- Provide clear privacy policy for room-specific tracking
- Encrypt location and task¬†reminder¬†data

title: foodcare
description:
I want to build a complete, responsive, and mobile-friendly web application called Campus & Hostel Food Sharing and Waste Reduction System. The website should support multiple user roles: Student, Canteen/Mess Staff, and Admin.

Features and Functionality:

Real-time food listing: Hostel mess and canteen staff can list available surplus food with type, quantity, expiry, and location.

Smart notifications: Students receive alerts about available food, menu updates, and expiring items.

Claim & Collect system: Students can claim food and track collection status.

Daily mess surplus tracker: Automatic tracking of leftover food after each meal.

Meal pre-booking & demand prediction: Students can pre-book meals to reduce over-preparation.

Sick meal request system: Students can request specific meals when unwell.

Out-of-station notifications: Students can mark themselves as away so staff can adjust cooking quantities.

Feedback & complaint portal: Students can submit complaints or suggestions about food quality and hygiene.

Impact & analytics dashboard:
  - Displays meals shared, food claimed, and food wasted.
  - Predicts how much food can be reduced in upcoming weeks based on historical data.
  - Tracks sustainability metrics like CO‚ÇÇ saved and resource optimization.

Surplus Food Ordering (Swiggy-like feature):
  - Nearby students or staff can order available surplus food via the platform.
  - Option to choose pickup from mess/canteen.
  - Live order tracking for donors and recipients.

Nutrition & Diet Tracking using Computer Vision:
  - Users can upload images of meals.
  - CV model predicts calories, protein, carb, and fat content of meals.
  - Diet suggestions for sick students or those with dietary restrictions (like diabetes or allergies).
  - Nutritional data integrated into the analytics dashboard for food tracking and predictive planning.

Role-based dashboards:
  - Students: view food listings, claim/order meals, track nutrition, and provide feedback.
  - Canteen/Mess Staff: manage food listings, track claims & orders, update menus, view food consumption, waste analytics, and nutrition info.
  - Admin: manage users, view overall analytics, generate reports, monitor predictive reduction and nutrition trends.

Push notifications and alerts: Real-time updates for students and staff.

Design and UI Requirements:

Clean, modern, and intuitive interface

Responsive for desktop and mobile

Live map to show available food locations

Easy-to-use forms for requests, feedback, orders, and nutrition uploads

Dashboard charts for analytics (food claimed, wasted, predicted reduction, nutrition info)

Tech Stack:

Frontend: React.js (or Flutter for mobile app)

Backend: Node.js with Express or Django

Database: MongoDB or Firebase Firestore

APIs: Google Maps, Push Notifications

Computer Vision Module: TensorFlow / PyTorch for meal image recognition and nutrition estimation

Additional Requirements:

Include full project structure (frontend, backend, database, CV module)

Include sample data for testing

Provide comments and explanations in code

- üé§ Ask by Voice button
- üåø Upload Leaf Image

additionalNotes:
# üåæ Farmer Assistant Web Application - Roadmap

## 1. Project Setup
- **Frontend:** React.js (web interface for farmers)
- **Backend:** Node.js + Express.js
- **Database:** MongoDB Atlas
- **AI Models:** Python (Flask/FastAPI microservices)

üëâ Architecture: **React (Frontend)** ‚Üî **Node.js (Backend)** ‚Üî **Python ML Services**

---

## 2. AI Voice Assistant Module
**Purpose:** Help farmers ask questions by voice.  
**Tasks:**
- Voice ‚Üí Text (Google Speech-to-Text API)
- Query Understanding (HuggingFace NLP model)
- Apply rule-based logic (fertilizer, irrigation, crop advice)
- Text ‚Üí Voice (Google TTS in local language)

**Integration:**  
- React üé§ button ‚Üí `/voice` API ‚Üí Python FastAPI ‚Üí Backend ‚Üí Farmer gets voice reply.  
**Tech:** Python, HuggingFace, Google STT & TTS

---

## 3. Leaf Disease Detection Module
**Purpose:** Detect crop diseases early.  
**Tasks:**
- Upload/Take picture of leaf
- Preprocess (resize, normalize) using OpenCV/PIL
- CNN model (TensorFlow/Keras) predicts disease
- Return { disease_name, remedies }

**Integration:**  
- React üåø upload ‚Üí `/disease` API ‚Üí Python FastAPI ‚Üí return prediction  
**Tech:** Python, TensorFlow/Keras, OpenCV, PIL

---

## 4. Crop Price & Weather Module
**Purpose:** Provide live crop prices + weather forecasts.  
**Tasks:**
- Fetch live crop prices via REST APIs
- Fetch real-time weather data (OpenWeatherMap API)
- Store/cache results in MongoDB for efficiency

**Integration:**  
- React üìà /‚òÅÔ∏è buttons ‚Üí `/crop-price` and `/weather` APIs  
**Tech:** Node.js/Python, REST APIs

---

## 5. Notifications Module
**Purpose:** Proactive alerts for farmers.  
**Tasks:**
- Daily notifications: weather, fertilizer, irrigation reminders
- Use cron jobs for scheduling
- Send via:
  - Firebase Cloud Messaging (web push)
  - Twilio (SMS/Voice)
  - Email (Nodemailer)

**Integration:**  
- Backend triggers `/notify` API ‚Üí farmers get üîî alerts  
**Tech:** Firebase / Twilio / Node.js

---

## 6. Backend Integration Module
**Purpose:** Connect all modules.  
**Tasks:**
- Node.js + Express APIs:
  - `POST /voice` ‚Üí AI Voice Assistant
  - `POST /disease` ‚Üí Leaf Disease Detection
  - `GET /crop-price` ‚Üí Crop Price info
  - `GET /weather` ‚Üí Weather info
  - `POST /notify` ‚Üí Send notifications
- MongoDB: store users, queries, preferences

**Tech:** Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, REST APIs

---

## 7. Frontend (Web Application)
**Purpose:** Farmer-friendly web interface.  
**Features:**
- üé§ Ask by Voice button
- üåø Upload Leaf Image
- üìà Check Crop Price
- ‚òÅÔ∏è Check Weather
- üîî Notification panel
- Local language support (Tamil/Hindi etc. via i18n)

**Tech:** React.js, JavaScript, UI/UX Design

title: StacklyHub
description:
# üè´ Training Tracker System

A comprehensive training management system built with Django REST API backend and React frontend. Designed to streamline the management of training programs, batches, trainers, and trainees with role-based access control.

## ‚ú® Features

### üîê Authentication & Authorization
- JWT-based authentication with refresh tokens
- Role-based access control (Admin, Trainer, Trainee)
- Password reset functionality
- Secure user registration and login

### üë• User Management
- Multi-role user system (Admin, Trainer, Trainee)
- User profile management
- Role-specific dashboards and permissions
- Audit logging for all user actions

### üìö Training Programs
- Create and manage training programs
- Program categorization and descriptions
- Topic-wise program structure
- Program status tracking (Active/Inactive)

### üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Batch Management
- Create and manage training batches
- Assign programs to batches
- Trainer and trainee assignments
- Batch progress tracking

### üìä Progress Tracking
- Individual trainee progress monitoring
- Topic-wise completion tracking
- Progress reports and analytics
- Performance metrics

### üéì Classes & Sessions
- Schedule and manage training classes
- Class attendance tracking
- Trainer session management
- Class materials and resources

### üîß Admin Features
- Complete user management
- System configuration
- Data export and reporting
- Audit trail monitoring

## üõ† Technology Stack

### Backend
- **Django 5.2** - Python web framework
- **Django REST Framework** - API development
- **Simple JWT** - JSON Web Token authentication
- **SQLite** - Database (development)
- **MySQL** - Database (production ready)
- **Django CORS Headers** - Cross-origin resource sharing

### Frontend
- **React 19** - Frontend framework
- **Material-UI (MUI)** - Component library
- **React Router** - Client-side routing
- **Axios** - HTTP client
- **React Hook Form** - Form management
additionalNotes:
## üì° API Endpoints

### Authentication
- `POST /api/token/` - Obtain JWT token
- `POST /api/token/refresh/` - Refresh JWT token
- `POST /api/register/` - User registration
- `POST /api/password-reset/` - Request password reset
- `GET /api/auth/user/` - Get current user info

### Users
- `GET /api/users/` - List all users (Admin only)
- `POST /api/users/` - Create new user (Admin only)
- `GET /api/users/{id}/` - Get user details
- `PUT /api/users/{id}/` - Update user
- `DELETE /api/users/{id}/` - Delete user

### Programs
- `GET /api/programs/` - List all programs
- `POST /api/programs/` - Create new program (Admin only)
- `GET /api/programs/{id}/` - Get program details
- `PUT /api/programs/{id}/` - Update program
- `DELETE /api/programs/{id}/` - Delete program

### Batches
- `GET /api/batches/` - List all batches
- `POST /api/batches/` - Create new batch (Trainer/Admin)
- `GET /api/batches/{id}/` - Get batch details
- `PUT /api/batches/{id}/` - Update batch
- `DELETE /api/batches/{id}/` - Delete batch

### Progress Records
- `GET /api/progress-records/` - List progress records
- `POST /api/progress-records/` - Create progress record
- `GET /api/progress-records/{id}/` - Get progress details
- `PUT /api/progress-records/{id}/` - Update progress
- `DELETE /api/progress-records/{id}/` - Delete progress

## üë§ User Roles & Permissions

### Super Admin
- Full system access
- User management
- System configuration
- All CRUD operations

### Trainer
- Manage assigned batches
- View trainee progress
- Create and update classes
- Update progress records

### Trainee
- View own profile
- View enrolled batches
- View own progress
- Update personal information

## üóÑ Database Models

### User
- Custom user model with roles
- Profile information
- Authentication fields

### Program
- Training program details
- Topics and descriptions
- Status management

### Batch
- Training batch information
- Program associations
- Trainer assignments

### BatchTrainee
- Trainee-batch relationships
- Enrollment status
- Completion tracking

### ProgressRecord
- Individual progress tracking
- Topic-wise completion
- Performance metrics

### Class
- Training session details
- Schedule management
- Attendance tracking

title: SecureDocs ‚Äì Student Document Locker
description: SecureDocs is a cloud-based document locker designed for students to securely store, manage, and share their personal documents such as ID cards, marksheets, certificates, and assignments. The system allows students to register and log in, upload documents with metadata (title, type, year, course, tags), view and download their files, and generate secure shareable links. Uploaded files are stored safely in the cloud, while document information is managed in a database. The platform also includes features like document search, filtering, soft-delete/archive, and optional admin management for monitoring users and documents. The user interface is simple, modern, and mobile-friendly, ensuring a smooth experience for students with easy access to all their important documents.
additionalNotes:
Target Users:

College or school students who need a secure place to store personal documents digitally.

Optional: Admin users who can monitor usage and manage documents.

Security Considerations:

Passwords should be stored securely (hashed).

Only authenticated users can access their own documents.

Shared links can have expiry and read-only permissions.

Validate uploaded file types (PDF, PNG, JPG) and limit file size (e.g., 10MB).

File Storage:

Use a secure cloud storage service like Cloudinary or Firebase Storage.

Store only file URLs in the database for easy access.

Database Management:

Use MongoDB Atlas to manage users and documents collections.

Keep fields like: ownerId, title, type, year, tags, file URL, archived status, shared tokens.

Frontend / User Interface:

Simple, clean, and responsive design.

Dashboard shows uploaded documents in cards or list view.

Include forms for login, registration, document upload, and search/filter functionality.

Optional Features:

Admin dashboard for monitoring students and documents.

Document versioning (store previous versions of the same file).

Notifications when documents are shared or nearing expiry.

Search by tags, course, or year for faster access.

No-Code/Low-Code Implementation:

Can be built using Vibe/Dora AI for frontend and workflows.

Database integration with MongoDB Atlas for data storage.

Cloud storage integration for secure file uploads.

Minimal coding required; most features can be implemented visually.

Project Benefits:

Students can access all important documents anytime from one secure location.

Reduces risk of losing physical copies.

Easy sharing for applications, submissions, or verification.

title: TV application React Native
description:
# OTT TV App ‚Äî React Native scaffold & starter plan

This document contains a runnable plan, recommended tech stack, UX guidelines for TV, a proposed folder structure, essential features, and starter code snippets (Home screen, Detail screen, Video player) to get your OTT TV application built with React Native.

---

## 1) Project overview

Build an Over-The-Top (OTT) TV application that runs on Android TV and tvOS (Apple TV) using React Native. Key requirements typically include:

* Browse catalogs (movies, series, shorts)
* Search and categories
* Detail pages with metadata and trailer
* HLS streaming with adaptive bitrate
* DRM support (Widevine on Android, FairPlay on tvOS) ‚Äî later step
* Authentication and subscriptions
* Remote (D-pad) friendly navigation and focus management
* Leanback-style UI with large artwork and rows of content

---

## 2) Recommended tech stack

* **Frontend**: React Native (supports tvOS & Android TV) using the official React Native package that supports tv platforms.
* **Navigation**: `react-navigation` (works on TV) + focusable components
* **Video player**: `react-native-video` for HLS playback (works with ExoPlayer on Android, AVPlayer on iOS/tvOS)
* **Focus management**: use built-in `useTVEventHandler` + `TVFocusGuide` patterns. Optionally `react-native-tvfocusable` or `react-native-tvos-controller` utilities if you want helpers.
* **State management**: Context + `react-query` (or RTK Query) for server data fetching and caching
* **Auth**: OAuth/JWT with backend endpoints
* **Backend**: Node.js + Express or Fastify (GraphQL optional). Media served via CDN supporting HLS (CloudFront, Fastly) and DRM via a packager (Shaka, BuyDRM, MUX DRM, or CDN-managed DRM).
* **Storage**: Postgres for metadata, Redis for sessions/caching
* **CI/CD**: GitHub Actions, EAS (Expo Application Services) or Fastlane for building tvOS/Android TV artifacts

---

## 3) UX & Accessibility (TV-specific)

* Use large tappable areas and clear focus states (outline + scale + elevation).
* Remote navigation: D-pad left/right/up/down + play/pause buttons.
* Avoid text input where possible; if search is required, provide on-screen keyboard or voice input.
* Focus order must be deterministic ‚Äî design a grid/row layout similar to Leanback.
* Minimum safe tap area: 48‚Äì64 dp.
* Keep icons and text legible at typical viewing distance.

---

## 4) Core features (MVP)

1. Home screen with rows (Carousels) of content
2. Detail screen with metadata and play/trailer buttons
3. Secure HLS playback (tokenized manifest URLs for basic protection)
4. Authentication and user profile
5. Category filtering and search
6. Favorites / watchlist
7. Player with resume-from-last-position and basic controls

---

## 5) Folder structure (suggested)

```
my-ott-tv/
‚îú‚îÄ app/                      # RN app entry (if using expo or plain RN)
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ components/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ CarouselRow.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ FocusableCard.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ Header.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ screens/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ HomeScreen.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ DetailScreen.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ PlayerScreen.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ navigation/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ index.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ hooks/
‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ services/
‚îÇ     ‚îî‚îÄ api.ts
‚îú‚îÄ server/                   # simple metadata + auth service
‚îú‚îÄ infra/                    # deployment scripts, drm integration notes
‚îî‚îÄ package.json
```

---

## 6) Starter code snippets

> Note: these are minimal examples meant to run as starting points. They use TypeScript-like syntax but you can adapt to JS.

### FocusableCard component (key for remote navigation)

```tsx
import React from 'react';
import { View, Text, Image, Pressable } from 'react-native';

export default function FocusableCard({ title, poster, onPress, isFocused }) {
  return (
    <Pressable onPress={onPress} style={({ pressed }) => ({
      margin: 8,
      transform: [{ scale: pressed || isFocused ? 1.06 : 1 }],
      shadowOpacity: pressed || isFocused ? 0.35 : 0,
    })}>
      <Image source={{ uri: poster }} style={{ width: 320, height: 180, borderRadius: 8 }} />
      <Text numberOfLines={1} style={{ marginTop: 8, width: 320 }}>{title}</Text>
    </Pressable>
  );
}
```

### HomeScreen (rows of focusable items)

```tsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import { View, Text, FlatList } from 'react-native';
import FocusableCard from '../components/FocusableCard';

export default function HomeScreen({ navigation }) {
  const [rows] = useState([ /* your rows data from API */ ]);

  return (
    <View style={{ flex: 1, backgroundColor: '#000' }}>
      <Text style={{ fontSize: 38, margin: 16, color: '#fff' }}>Featured</Text>
      <FlatList
        horizontal
        data={rows[0].items}
        keyExtractor={i => i.id}
        renderItem={({ item }) => (
          <FocusableCard
            title={item.title}
            poster={item.poster}
            onPress={() => navigation.navigate('Detail', { id: item.id })}
          />
        )}
      />
    </View>
  );
}
```

### PlayerScreen (react-native-video example)

```tsx
import React, { useRef } from 'react';
import { View } from 'react-native';
import Video from 'react-native-video';

export default function PlayerScreen({ route }) {
  const playerRef = useRef(null);
  const { hlsUrl } = route.params;

  return (
    <View style={{ flex: 1, backgroundColor: '#000' }}>
      <Video
        ref={playerRef}
        source={{ uri: hlsUrl }}
        style={{ flex: 1 }}
        controls
        resizeMode="contain"
        onError={(e) => console.error('video error', e)}
      />
    </View>
  );
}
```

---

## 7) Backend & streaming notes

* Serve HLS manifests (.m3u8) via CDN. Use short-lived signed URLs to protect manifests.
* For DRM: integrate a packager and license server for Widevine (Android) and FairPlay (Apple). This is complex and usually handled by a third-party packager or CDN.
* Implement resume and offline position storing in your backend or local storage.

---

## 8) Development & testing tips

* Test on actual devices (Android TV emulator is okay but test on real Android TV box and Apple TV).
* Use tvOS simulator for initial UI testing.
* Use `adb` remote control or simulator's remote to test D-pad navigation.
* Log focus events and ensure focus flows correctly.

---

## 9) Next steps I can help with (choose any)

* Generate a runnable starter repo (React Native + sample screens + video player) ‚Äî I can scaffold it.
* Create production-ready PlayerScreen with resume, DRM stub, and analytics hooks.
* Design home-screen UI (mockups) and provide pixel-perfect component code.
* Backend API spec for metadata, auth, subscriptions, and tokenized HLS URLs.

Tell me which next step you'd like and I'll continue.

---

*End of document.*
additionalNotes: This document contains a runnable plan, recommended tech stack, UX guidelines for TV, a proposed folder structure, essential features, and starter code snippets (Home screen, Detail screen, Video player) to get your OTT TV application built with React Native.

title: KSS Airways flight booking system
description:
‚úàÔ∏è Prompt for Full Flight Booking System (KSSS Airways)

Objective:
Build a complete Flight Booking & Management System website for KSSS Airways with modern UI, real-world booking flow, and database integration.

Core Modules & Features:

Frontend UI/UX

Responsive website with header, footer, and navigation bar.

Homepage: flight search form, latest offers carousel, user login/signup.

Search Flights Page:

From / To airports with suggestion dropdown (airport code, city, country).

Departure & return date pickers.

Trip type: One-way, Round-trip, Multi-city.

Passengers (adults, children, infants).

Travel class: Economy, Premium, Business, First Class.

Flight Results Page: list of available flights with details (airline, duration, stops, baggage info, fare).

Booking Page:

Passenger details form.

Seat selection grid.

Extra options (meals, luggage, insurance).

Payment Page:

Card/UPI/Netbanking payment simulation.

Confirmation page with PNR & e-Ticket PDF download.

User Account Management

Login/Signup with session handling.

Profile management (name, email, phone, saved passengers, payment methods).

My Bookings: view & manage upcoming/past trips.

Cancel / Reschedule option.

Admin Dashboard

Secure login for admins.

Manage flights (add, edit, delete flight schedules).

View passenger bookings.

Revenue & traffic analytics (charts).

Database (MySQL or SQLite)

users (id, name, email, password, phone).

flights (id, airline, from, to, departure, arrival, price, class, seats).

bookings (id, user_id, flight_id, passengers, status, payment).

transactions (id, booking_id, amount, payment_method, status).

Extra Features (Optional but Recommended)

Real-time flight seat availability.

Email confirmation (with booking ticket).

Dynamic pricing (based on demand/time).

Live offers & discounts section.

Dark/Light theme toggle.

Technical Stack (Flexible):

Frontend: HTML, CSS, JavaScript (with animations, responsive design).

Backend: PHP / Node.js / Django (choose one).

Database: MySQL.

Extras: Chart.js for analytics, AJAX for smooth data fetch, LocalStorage/Session for login state.

Expected Output:

A fully functional airline booking system with end-to-end flow:

Search ‚Üí Select Flight ‚Üí Book ‚Üí Pay ‚Üí Confirm ‚Üí View Booking.

Modern, professional, and user-friendly UI.

Database-driven with dynamic data handling.
additionalNotes:
Smart Search Enhancements

Auto-suggestion for airports with IATA codes, city, country.

Recently searched routes history.

Price prediction (e.g., ‚ÄúPrices may rise in 3 days‚Äù).

Seat & Cabin Experience

Interactive seat map (pick seat by clicking on seat grid).

Seat categories (extra legroom, window, aisle, emergency exit).

Cabin preview images (Economy, Business, First Class).

Offers & Loyalty System

Promo codes / discount coupons.

Loyalty program: earn points with bookings.

Redeem points for discounts.

Multi-Currency & Localization

Prices shown in INR + global currencies.

Support for multiple languages (English, Hindi, etc.).

Notifications & Reminders

Email/SMS confirmation after booking.

Reminder email 24 hours before flight.

‚ÄúCheck-in now‚Äù notification link.

Booking Flexibility

Hold a booking (lock fare for 24 hrs).

Cancel or reschedule flights.

Travel insurance add-on.

Payment & Security

Multiple payment options (UPI, Cards, NetBanking, Wallets).

OTP verification before payment.

Invoice download (PDF).

Admin Advanced Tools

Revenue & booking analytics (charts, graphs).

Daily/weekly/monthly sales reports.

Flight occupancy & seat load factor tracking.

Manage users & blacklist fraudulent accounts.

Traveler Convenience Features

Save frequent travelers (auto-fill passenger details).

Special assistance request (wheelchair, meals).

Add-ons: extra baggage, lounge access.

Check-in online (seat confirmation before airport).

Modern UI Additions

Dark/Light theme toggle.

Mobile-first responsive design.

Animated flight tracker (map view of journey).

title: SharkTank
description:
import React from "react"; /** SharkTank-as-a-Service ‚Äî Prompts & Starter UI (React + Tailwind) This single-file React component is a human-readable deliverable containing: Ready-to-use AI prompt(s) for UI generation Developer brief and feature list Pages, buttons, user stories, and privacy rules (projects isolated) Tailwind theme tokens (blue theme) and component skeletons You can paste the text below into a project README or feed the prompts to an AI designer. --- AI DESIGN PROMPT (use with UI generator or design tool): "Design a clean, modern web dashboard for a 'SharkTank as a Service' platform. Theme: normal blue (primary #1e40af or similar). Tone: professional, simple, trustworthy. Primary pages: Founder Dashboard, Plan Submit (create new project), Project Details (private), Investor View (read-only for approved investors), Admin Console. Key constraints: each project must be private by default ‚Äî founders can invite collaborators or publish a public pitch. No founder can view other founders' project plans unless explicitly invited. Required components: top navigation with logo + user avatar, left column navigation (collapsible), a card grid for projects, a modal for pitch submission (steps: Basics, Problem, Solution, Go-To-Market, Ask), toast notifications, and a reusable Form component with validation. Visual: lots of whitespace, readable typography, 2xl rounded cards, soft shadows, accent blue buttons, subtle micro-interactions for hover/focus. Use Tailwind CSS utility classes for layout. Mobile-first responsive layout. Output: provide Figma-like layout suggestions and Tailwind class names for each major component." DEVELOPER PROMPT / BRIEF (copy into issue tracker): Title: MVP ‚Äî Founder Dashboard + Plan Submit Stack: React (create-react-app or Vite), Tailwind CSS, optional backend (Node/Express or Firebase/Auth), DB: Firestore/Postgres. Auth: email/password + OAuth. Roles: founder, investor, admin. Core features for MVP: Secure sign-up / login / role assignment. Founder Dashboard: list of founder's projects (cards) + quick create button. Plan Submit flow: multi-step submission: Title, Short Pitch, Problem, Solution, Market, Business Model, Ask (funds/equity), Attachments (PDF/images), Visibility (private/invite/public). Project privacy: default PRIVATE (only owner + invited collaborators and approved investors with access). No cross-project browsing. Project Details page: shows pitch, attachments, timeline, comments (private), and a "Request Intro" button to contact investor (email/in-app message). Admin panel: approve/reject investor access requests, manage categories/tags. PAGES & BUTTONS (suggested): Pages: Landing / Home (marketing + login) Sign up / Login Founder Dashboard (my projects) Plan Submit (multi-step wizard) Project Details (owner view) Investor Dashboard (approved projects only) Admin Console Buttons & Actions: New Project (primary) Submit / Save Draft / Publish Invite Collaborator Request Access (investor) Approve Access (admin) Download Pitch Deck Edit Project Archive / Delete (owner) USER STORIES (short): As a Founder, I can create a private project plan and save it as draft. As a Founder, I can invite specific collaborators to view/edit my project. As an Investor, I can request access to view a private project; the founder will approve/deny. As Admin, I can moderate published pitches and manage user roles. PRIVACY RULES (MUST): Projects default to PRIVATE. Only the owner and explicitly invited collaborators can view or edit. Sharing generates a secure invite link with expiry (optional). Searching or browsing other founders' projects is disabled unless the project is published. TAILWIND THEME TOKENS (suggested): Primary Blue: #1e40af (use as --color-primary) Accent / CTA: #2563eb Surface / Card: bg-white, ring-1 with subtle shadow Radius: rounded-2xl for cards, rounded-md for inputs Spacing: use container widths, p-6, gap-4 COMPONENT SKELETONS (JSX/Tailwind ready) TopNav, SideNav, ProjectCard, MultiStepForm, Modal, Toast --- Below are very short copy prompts for microcopy inside the app (labels, placeholders): Project title placeholder: "E.g. CleanCharge ‚Äî portable EV charger for apartments" Short pitch: "Explain your idea in one sentence (25‚Äì140 chars)" Ask: "How much funding do you need? (‚Çπ / $) and what equity are you offering?" Visibility toggle: "Private ‚Äî Only invited collaborators can view" / "Public ‚Äî Visible to approved investors" Button: Primary: "Create project" / Secondary: "Save draft" */ export default function SharkTankPrompts() { return (
ST

SharkTank-as-a-Service ‚Äî Prompts & Starter UI

React + Tailwind starter: blue theme, privacy-first, founder-first UX.

What I added

  • AI design prompt for UI generation
  • Developer brief + MVP feature list
  • Pages, buttons, user stories and privacy rules
  • Tailwind theme tokens and component suggestions

Next steps

  1. Copy the AI DESIGN PROMPT into your chosen UI generator (Figma/AI) to get visuals.
  2. Scaffold a React + Tailwind app (Vite recommended), implement auth and the multi-step form.
  3. Enforce privacy rules at the API and UI level so projects remain isolated.
Theme: standard blue. Stack: React, HTML, Tailwind CSS.
If you want, I can also: generate the multi-step Plan Submit component code, produce Figma-ready layout specs, or write backend API endpoints (Node/Express) ‚Äî tell me which and I will create it.
); } and follow the workflow"ü¶à SharkTank SaaS ‚Äì Complete Workflow --- User Onboarding Innovator: Signup / Login ‚Üí Create profile ‚Üí Add patent status ‚Üí Upload pitch deck (PDF/video). Investor: Signup / Login ‚Üí Create profile ‚Üí Select interest areas (industry, stage, funding range). --- Idea Posting (Innovator) Innovator posts idea: Title, description, categories (Industry, Stage) Patent filed/verified status Attach pitch deck or prototype video Optional: Additional documents for NDA-gated viewing. --- Idea Discovery & Matching Hackathon MVP: Investors search and filter by: Industry, Stage, Funding range, Patent status. Manual browsing of ideas ‚Üí click to view pitch. Full Vision (AI-powered): AI matches ideas to investors based on: Industry, patent domain, novelty Investor past investments / interests Risk profile, success probability Recommended ideas appear in investor dashboard ‚Üí ranked list. --- NDA & Secure Pitch Viewing Investor clicks on idea ‚Üí NDA acceptance popup. After accepting, investor can view: Full pitch deck Patent information Supporting documents Innovator can set visibility levels (full access, partial, or contact-only). --- Bidding / Investor Competition Investor submits a bid: Funding amount Short message / mentorship offer Optional: equity terms (simplified MVP) Innovator dashboard shows all active bids for their idea. Innovator chooses best-fit bid ‚Üí moves to chat/meeting stage. Optional Future Scope: Real-time auction timer ‚Üí encourages competitive offers AI suggestion: ‚ÄúMost likely best investor‚Äù --- Communication Chat or messaging system enables: Investor ‚Üî Innovator conversation Scheduling meetings MVP: Simple chat interface Future: Video calls, meeting scheduling, reminders --- Funding Workflow (Future Scope) After selecting an investor: Generate term sheet, SAFE, or equity agreement automatically Escrow-based fund transfer Track milestones and investment release Post-deal analytics ‚Üí KPIs, investor ratings, innovator progress --- Ratings & Trust System Innovators rate investors after engagement Investors rate innovators System tracks reputation ‚Üí helps future matching --- Global & Legal Compliance Multi-jurisdiction legal templates (NDA, term sheets) Support for multi-currency / cross-border investment Optional patent database integration ‚Üí auto-verify patent filings (WIPO, USPTO, IPO India) --- Dashboard & Analytics Innovator Dashboard: Ideas posted Active bids received Investor interest status Metrics: Views, engagement, average bid Investor Dashboard: Recommended ideas (AI) or search results Active bids submitted Tracking shortlisted innovators Analytics: Success rate, patent quality scoring --- Future Scope / Enhancements AI-powered matching & bid prediction Escrow, automatic term sheet, milestone tracking Patent valuation & IP success prediction Virtual SharkTank events / pitch competitions Global expansion with compliance support Integration with incubators, universities, and accelerators --- give the "same prompt"

title: Kittu player
description:
Kittu Player is an intelligent, modern AI-powered music and video player designed for a seamless and personalized entertainment experience. Built using Android Studio (Kotlin), it supports all popular audio and video formats with a sleek, green-themed interface and smooth animations.

The app goes beyond traditional players by integrating AI-based recommendations and smart playback controls, allowing users to enjoy songs based on mood, preference, and listening history.
additionalNotes:
Kittu Player is designed with a focus on simplicity, speed, and intelligence. The app ensures smooth performance even on low-end devices while maintaining high-quality playback.

It aims to combine the power of artificial intelligence with a clean and user-friendly interface, giving users a smarter and more enjoyable way to listen to music. Future updates will include AI voice assistant integration, lyrics synchronization, and cloud-based music recommendations.

title: Smart study planner
description:
Goal:
Build a full-stack ‚ÄúSmart Study Planner‚Äù web app that helps students manage assignments, exams, and study schedules using an intelligent task planner with reminders and analytics.

üß† Features & Functionality

Authentication

User registration and login (email/password, Google OAuth).

Secure JWT authentication (access + refresh tokens).

Task & Exam Management

Create, edit, and delete tasks (title, course, priority, due date, estimated duration).

Create exams with date, topics, and reminders.

Mark tasks as complete and track progress.

Smart Scheduler

Auto-schedule tasks into available time slots based on:

Priority

Due date proximity

Estimated time

User‚Äôs daily availability

Store generated study sessions in a calendar.

Reminders & Notifications

Notify users before study sessions or due dates via:

Web push notifications

Email alerts

Background job queue to handle reminders reliably.

Dashboard & Analytics

Show today‚Äôs schedule, completed vs pending tasks.

Weekly progress chart and streak tracking.

üß© Tech Stack

Frontend:

Next.js (React + JavaScript)

Tailwind CSS

Axios for API calls

PWA with offline mode + push notifications

Backend:

Node.js + Express (JavaScript)

PostgreSQL + Prisma ORM

Redis + BullMQ for background jobs (reminders)

SendGrid (emails), Web Push API (notifications)

Deployment:

Frontend ‚Üí Vercel

Backend ‚Üí Render 

Database ‚Üí PostgreSQL (Supabase / Neon)

Redis ‚Üí Upstash Redis

‚öôÔ∏è Core API Endpoints
Method	Endpoint	Description
POST	/api/auth/register	Register new user
POST	/api/auth/login	Login + issue JWT
GET	/api/tasks	List all tasks
POST	/api/tasks	Create a task
PATCH	/api/tasks/:id	Update or complete a task
POST	/api/schedule/auto	Generate study sessions automatically
GET	/api/schedule/today	Get today‚Äôs schedule
POST	/api/notifications/subscribe	Register web push subscription
GET	/api/analytics/weekly	Fetch weekly stats
üóÇÔ∏è Database Schema (simplified Prisma model)
model User {
  id          String   @id @default(uuid())
  email       String   @unique
  password    String
  tasks       Task[]
  sessions    StudySession[]
  reminders   Reminder[]
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
}

model Task {
  id          String   @id @default(uuid())
  userId      String
  title       String
  priority    String
  estimatedMins Int
  dueDate     DateTime
  status      String   @default("todo")
  user        User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
}

model StudySession {
  id        String   @id @default(uuid())
  userId    String
  taskId    String?
  startTime DateTime
  endTime   DateTime
  status    String   @default("scheduled")
  user      User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
}

üßÆ Auto-Scheduler Logic (Backend)

Algorithm to create study sessions:

// Pseudocode
for each pending task:
  urgency = (0.6 * (1 / daysUntilDue)) + (0.4 * priorityWeight)
sort tasks by urgency desc
fill available daily slots with high urgency tasks first
split long tasks into 50-min sessions
save sessions into DB

üîî Reminder System

Use BullMQ + Redis to queue reminders.

Jobs trigger push/email notifications 30 min before each study session.

Retry failed jobs up to 3 times.

üîí Security

Hash passwords with bcrypt.

Validate and sanitize all inputs.

Use HTTPS and secure cookies for refresh tokens.

‚òÅÔ∏è Deployment Instructions

Setup environment variables:

DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:pass@host/db
JWT_SECRET=your_jwt_secret
REDIS_URL=redis://...
SENDGRID_API_KEY=...
VAPID_PUBLIC_KEY=...
VAPID_PRIVATE_KEY=...


Run locally:

docker-compose up -d
npm install
npx prisma migrate dev
npm run dev


Deploy:

Frontend: Deploy to Vercel.

Backend: Deploy to Render/Railway with Docker.

DB/Redis: Use hosted services (Supabase, Upstash).

‚úÖ Expected Output from the AI Tool

/frontend ‚Üí Next.js app with Tailwind UI for Dashboard, Planner, Tasks, Settings.

/backend ‚Üí Express API with routes above, Prisma setup, and background worker.

/prisma ‚Üí schema file + seed script.

docker-compose.yml ‚Üí PostgreSQL + Redis + backend.

README.md ‚Üí Run + deploy instructions.

title: Self ETL
description:
Enhanced User Flow Ideas
1. Visual Table Relationship Explorer

Interactive graph/network view - Show tables as nodes, relationships as edges
Click to explore - Click a table to see its connections expand outward
Relationship strength indicators - Show how many records are typically joined
Color coding - Different colors for incoming vs outgoing relationships

2. Smart Join Suggestions

Auto-detect join types - Suggest INNER/LEFT based on data patterns
Join quality indicators - Show % of records that will match
Multiple join path options - If Table A connects to Table C through Table B
Historical join patterns - "Users often join these tables together"

3. Progressive Table Building

Step-by-step wizard - Guide users through the selection process
Preview at each step - Show sample data as they add joins
Undo/Redo functionality - Let them go back and modify selections
Save partial configurations - Resume complex joins later

4. Advanced Selection Features

Column-level selection - Choose specific columns from each joined table
Filter before join - Apply WHERE conditions to reduce data before joining
Aggregation options - GROUP BY, SUM, COUNT after joining
Custom column creation - Add calculated fields during the join process

5. Data Quality Insights

Relationship health check - Show orphaned records, missing references
Data volume estimates - Predict result set size before executing
Performance warnings - Alert if joins might be slow
Duplicate detection - Warn about potential duplicate records after join

6. Template & Pattern Recognition

Common join patterns - Save frequently used table combinations
Business templates - Pre-built joins for common business scenarios
Auto-complete suggestions - Based on table/column names and previous usage
Pattern learning - System learns from user behavior

7. Validation & Testing

Dry run mode - Show EXPLAIN plan without executing
Sample data preview - Show first 100 rows of result
Data validation rules - Check for expected relationships and constraints
A/B comparison - Compare results with previous versions

title: A Multi-Agent Context-Aware Access Control and Cryptographic Framework for Secure Cloud-Based EHR Systems Using Trusted Third Partie
description:
A Multi-Agent Context-Aware Access Control and Cryptographic Framework for Secure Cloud-Based EHR Systems Using Trusted Third Parties
Domain: Cybersecurity
Technologies Used: Python, Flask, MongoDB, JWT, Fernet Encryption, PyMongo, Werkzeug
ABSTRACT: Electronic Health Records (EHR) systems face critical security challenges in maintaining patient privacy while enabling authorized healthcare professionals to access medical data efficiently. Traditional access control mechanisms often lack granular patient-controlled permissions and fail to provide adequate encryption for sensitive medical information. This research presents a comprehensive context-aware access control system that empowers patients to define personalized access policies while ensuring robust data protection through advanced encryption techniques. The primary objective is to develop a secure, scalable EHR management system that bridges the gap between patient autonomy and healthcare accessibility by implementing dynamic policy-based authentication with access monitoring. Current healthcare systems lack patient-centric control mechanisms and fail to provide transparent access logging, creating vulnerabilities in medical data protection. Our solution employs Flask-based RESTful APIs integrated with MongoDB for scalable data management, JWT tokens for secure authentication, and Fernet symmetric encryption for per-file data protection. The system incorporates a Trusted Third Party (TTP) architecture enabling administrative oversight while maintaining patient privacy. Performance metrics demonstrate efficient access request processing with comprehensive audit trails, ensuring HIPAA compliance and enhanced security. The framework successfully addresses unauthorized access prevention, patient empowerment in data control, and transparent healthcare data management, establishing a new paradigm for secure medical information systems.
Keywords: Electronic Health Records, Context-Aware Access Control, Healthcare Security, Policy-Based Authentication, Medical Data Encryption
NOVELTY 
Per-File Encryption Key Generation - Each EHR record uses a unique Fernet encryption key stored alongside the encrypted data, enhancing security isolation.
Patient-Controlled Access Policy Definition - Patients can dynamically define and update their own access policies specifying which doctors can access their records.
Access Request Timing Metrics - The system tracks and logs the exact time taken for each EHR access request for performance monitoring.
Dual Authentication Architecture - Combines JWT token-based authentication with role-based access control and policy validation in a single request flow.
Trusted Third Party (TTP) Administrative Layer - Separate TTP endpoints for system administration, user management, and policy oversight independent of patient-doctor interactions.
Dynamic Encryption Key Revocation - TTP can revoke encryption keys for specific patients, rendering their EHR data inaccessible even if policies allow access.
Granular Access Logging with Status Tracking - Comprehensive logging system that records patient email, doctor email, timestamp, access status, and request processing time.
Symmetric Key Encryption with Database Storage - Fernet encryption keys are generated per file and stored in the database alongside encrypted content for decentralized key management.
Policy-Based Access Validation Pipeline - Multi-layer validation checking user roles, patient policies, and doctor authorization before granting EHR access.
Integrated Notification System with Access Events - Automatic notification generation for patients when their EHR records are accessed by authorized healthcare providers.

Both admin and user should have secure login/signup with proper session handling, and the backend must use MongoDB local database. The frontend should be modern, responsive, and professional like a company website, with clear navigation and intuitive UI/UX.

title: Crystal Curve
description:
üõçÔ∏è Brand Description:

At Crystal Curve, we believe style is more than what you wear ‚Äî it‚Äôs how confidently you express yourself in every moment.
Our collection blends timeless design, premium quality, and modern comfort, ensuring you always find the right thing at the right time ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs a sleek outfit for work, an elegant accessory for evening wear, or a cozy piece for your home.

Every product from Crystal Curve is crafted with care, combining sustainability, sophistication, and purpose.
We focus on versatile fashion and lifestyle essentials that adapt seamlessly to your day ‚Äî helping you stay ready, refined, and radiant for every occasion.

---

Project Overview

The College App is a comprehensive digital communication and management platform designed to connect students, faculty, and campus administration under a single ecosystem. The app transforms traditional campus operations into a smart, technology-driven experience that enhances learning, collaboration, and productivity.


---

Core Idea

The main goal is to create a centralized college ecosystem that simplifies daily activities such as communication, event management, class updates, announcements, and student networking. The app acts as a virtual campus‚Äîwhere every student can learn, share, and grow together, anytime and anywhere.


---

Key Features

1. Smart Communication Hub:

Real-time chat system for students and staff.

Department-wise and class-wise discussion groups.

Broadcast announcements from administration.



2. Attendance & Academic Tracking:

Automated attendance marking and real-time tracking.

Grade and exam performance analytics.



3. Digital Notice Board:

Central space for campus news, circulars, and upcoming events.

Push notifications for urgent announcements.



4. E-Learning Integration:

Video lectures, study materials, and previous question papers.

AI-based progress tracking and personalized learning support.



5. Event & Club Management:

Students can register for events, workshops, and clubs through the app.

Event posters, results, and highlights displayed dynamically.



6. Social Feed & Portfolio:

Students can post creative works, achievements, or updates.

Acts like a professional portfolio inside the college network.



7. Admin Dashboard:

Faculty and management can control announcements, student data, and event approvals easily through a secure backend.


Impact

The College App bridges the communication gap between students and the institution. It reduces paperwork, saves time, and enhances student engagement through technology. Beyond academics, it encourages creativity, teamwork, and leadership‚Äîmaking college life more interactive and smart.


---

Vision

To create the next-generation digital campus‚Äîwhere every student feels connected, informed, and empowered. In the future, the app aims to expand with AI features like automated timetable suggestions, internship recommendations, and a digital ID system for attendance and exams.Impact

The College App bridges the communication gap between students and the institution. It reduces paperwork, saves time, and enhances student engagement through technology. Beyond academics, it encourages creativity, teamwork, and leadership‚Äîmaking college life more interactive and smart.


---

Vision

title: Smart Classroom & Timetable Scheduler Background
description:
The current scheduling mechanism in most higher education institutes/colleges relies on manual input via spreadsheets or basic tools. These fail to account for real-time availability of faculty, room capacity, teaching load norms, subject combinations, and student preferences. A solution is required that will accommodate the various parameters required for scheduling classes for UG and PG students and return an optimized timetable ensuring:
* Maximized utilization of classrooms and laboratories
* Minimized workload on faculty members and students
* Achievement of required learning outcomes

Key Parameters

The following parameters can be taken into account as variables for creating optimized timetables:
- Number of classrooms available
- Number of batches of students
- Number of subjects to be taught in a particular semester
- Names of subjects
- Maximum number of classes per day
- Number of classes to be conducted for a subject per week / per day
- Number of faculties available for different subjects
- Average number of leaves a faculty member takes in a month
- Special classes that have fixed slots in timetable
- Faculty can request their leave and their classes will exchange to other available faculties taking same class will be requested through call and mail on accepting the request  classes will be exchanged
Students may also consider additional variables that may help in effective timetable preparation.

Expected Solution

A web-based platform that can be linked to the college website. Authorized personnel will be able to login and input data against the listed variables to generate fully optimized timetables.

The platform should include:
* Login facility for authorized personnel to create and manage timetables and login for administrator and head of department 
* Multiple options of optimized timetables to choose from
* Review and approval workflow for competent authorities
* Suggestions for suitable rearrangements when optimal solutions are not available
* Support for multi-department and multi-shift scheduling
>faculties taking same class will be requested through call and mail on accepting the request  classes will be exchanged
Students may also consider additional variables that may help in effective timetable preparation.
it must include NODE JS for backend and REACT JS for frontend and for database it should use POSTgresql without any bugs and a professional user interface
additionalNotes:
Dashboard Design
Clean sidebar dashboard (ReactJS style) with sections: Dashboard, Timetable Input, Optimization Results, Faculty Requests, Approvals, Notifications, Settings

Main dashboard: Overview of current scheduling status, pending approvals, upcoming class swaps, and resource utilization graphs

Optimized timetable generator: Display multiple timetable proposals with color-coded clash detection, utilization heatmap, ‚Äòapprove‚Äô or ‚Äòrequest rearrangement‚Äô action buttons

Faculty leave/exchange module: Request leave, suggest alternate faculty, manage swap acceptances via calls and emails

PostgreSQL database connectivity, with clean error/success feedback for data operations

Responsive and accessible UI, with professional academic branding, modern sans-serif fonts, consistent color palette, and well-organized visual hierarchy

Prioritize a seamless, bug-free user experience. Focus on clear data flows, intuitive controls, and helpful tips/tooltips for each input parameter.

Use UI components that convey trust, efficiency, and modern educational technology.

title: FinOps
description:
A multi-cloud FinOps platform that lets authenticated users connect their cloud accounts (Azure, AWS, GCP) and continuously pull live billing/usage/metrics to show cost summaries, trends, top services, rightsizing recommendations, budget/alerts, and automated (recommendation-only) optimization suggestions. Frontend built with Next.js + React (SSR/ISR where helpful), backend using Next.js API routes / Node.js + Express / Nest (choose one) for connectors, scheduled jobs, and recommendation engine. Store metadata and credentials securely; sensitive credentials are not kept in plaintext.

Key features (high level)

User registration, login, profile management (email + password).

Add multiple cloud accounts per user: Azure (tenantId, clientId, clientSecret), AWS (accessKeyId, secretAccessKey, roleArn option), GCP (service account JSON).

Live data fetching: schedules + on-demand fetch for billing, usage, resource metadata, VM metrics.

Cost dashboards: total cost, cost by service, cost trends, top N resources by spend, cost forecast.

Recommendations: rightsizing VMs, idle resource detection, reserved instance/commitment suggestions, waste (orphaned disks, unattached IPs), tagging & cost allocation suggestions.

Budgets & alerts (email / webhook).

Anomaly detection for sudden cost spikes.

Export reports (CSV/PDF) and integration points (Slack/MS Teams, webhook).

Admin/tenant separation and role-based access control.

Users / User stories

User (cloud owner): Register, login, add cloud accounts, view dashboard, see recommendations, confirm or dismiss recommendations.

Finance role: View organization-level cost reports; export monthly reports.

Admin: Manage users, view audit logs, configure integrations (SMTP, Slack).

Architecture (high level)

Frontend (Next.js + React)

Pages: /login, /register, /dashboard, /account/clouds, /recommendations, /budgets, /reports, /settings.

Components: Auth forms, Cloud connectors forms, Dashboard cards, Charts (Plotly/Chart.js/Recharts), Tables, Modal for credential input.

Backend

API server: Next.js API routes or Node/Express for connectors & business logic.

Worker/Job scheduler: Pull data on schedule (cron) using a queue (BullMQ/Redis or AWS SQS).

Connector modules: one per cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP) encapsulating auth, pagination, rate-limit handling.

Recommendation engine: rules + heuristics + optional LLM-based summarization (recommendation-only).

Database: PostgreSQL (primary) + Redis (cache, rate-limiting).

Secrets: Vault (HashiCorp) or managed services (Azure Key Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, GCP Secret Manager).

Storage: Object storage for reports (S3/GCS/Azure Blob).

Monitoring & Logging

Centralized logging (ElasticSearch/ELK or Datadog).

Metrics with Prometheus + Grafana or cloud provider monitoring.

Diagram (text):
User ‚Üí Next.js Frontend ‚Üí Next.js API ‚Üí (DB, Queue, Workers) ‚Üí Cloud APIs (Azure/AWS/GCP)
Workers ‚Üí Recommendation Engine ‚Üí DB ‚Üí Frontend

Frontend UX flow & forms

Register: Email, password, name. Send verification email (tokenized link).

Login: Email + password ‚Üí JWT cookie (httpOnly) or NextAuth session.

Onboarding: Prompt to add a cloud account (or skip).

Add cloud account:

Azure: Tenant ID, Client ID, Client Secret (or use OAuth flow to avoid collecting secrets). Optional: subscription selectors, scope.

AWS: Option A - Access Key ID + Secret Access Key; Option B - External Role Arn + External ID (recommended for production). Option C - SSO/OIDC flow.

GCP: Upload service account JSON or paste credentials.

Validate credentials server-side on submit. Show success/failure and fetch initial data.

Dashboard: Top-line metrics, charts, top 10 services, recommendations panel.

Recommendations: List with severity, expected saving estimate, confidence score, affected resources; actions: dismiss, mark reviewed, export.

Budgets: Create budgets for subscriptions/accounts with threshold alerts.

Settings: Integrations (email, Slack), data fetch schedule.

API contract (examples)

Use REST or GraphQL. Example REST endpoints:

Auth

POST /api/auth/register
body: {email, password, name}
response: {userId, pendingVerification}

POST /api/auth/login
body: {email, password}
response: {token} (set as httpOnly cookie)

Cloud connectors

POST /api/clouds
body: {provider: 'azure'|'aws'|'gcp', name, credentials: {...}}
response: {cloudId, status}

GET /api/clouds ‚Üí list connected clouds for user

GET /api/clouds/:cloudId/validate ‚Üí returns {ok:true} or error details

Data & dashboards

GET /api/dashboard/summary?cloudId=&from=&to= ‚Üí {totalCost, trend, breakdownByService:[{service, cost}]}

GET /api/costs?cloudId=&from=&to=&groupBy=service,resource ‚Üí time-series & pagination

Recommendations

GET /api/recommendations?cloudId=&filter=... ‚Üí list of recs with {id, type, potentialSavingUSD, confidence, resources[]}

POST /api/recommendations/:id/action body {action: 'dismiss'|'apply'|'bookmarked', notes}

Jobs

POST /api/jobs/fetch?cloudId= ‚Üí trigger on-demand fetch

Alerts & budgets

POST /api/budgets body {cloudId, thresholdUSD, emails:[], webhookUrl}

Database design (core tables simplified)

users (id, email, password_hash, name, role, created_at)

user_profiles (user_id, company, timezone, preferences)

cloud_accounts (id, user_id, provider, name, credentials_ref, meta_json, status, last_sync)

cost_snapshots (id, cloud_id, date, total_cost, raw_data_ref)

cost_line_items (id, snapshot_id, resource_id, service, cost, usage, tags_json)

resources (id, cloud_id, resource_identifier, type, tags_json, owner)

recommendations (id, cloud_id, type, details_json, estimated_saving, status, created_at)

budgets, alerts, audit_logs

Store sensitive credentials as references to the secrets manager (credentials_ref), not plaintext.

Folder structure (suggested)

Frontend (Next.js)

finops-frontend/
‚îú‚îÄ app/                     # Next.js app dir or pages/
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ login/page.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ register/page.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ dashboard/page.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ clouds/[id]/page.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ components/
‚îÇ     ‚îú‚îÄ AuthForm/
‚îÇ     ‚îú‚îÄ DashboardCards/
‚îÇ     ‚îú‚îÄ Charts/
‚îÇ     ‚îî‚îÄ Recommendations/
‚îú‚îÄ lib/
‚îú‚îÄ hooks/
‚îú‚îÄ styles/
‚îú‚îÄ public/
‚îú‚îÄ next.config.js
‚îî‚îÄ package.json


Backend (Next API / Node)

finops-backend/
‚îú‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ api/                   # REST routes (if not using Next)
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ connectors/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ azureConnector.ts
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ awsConnector.ts
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ gcpConnector.ts
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ workers/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ fetchJob.ts
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ services/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ recommendationService.ts
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ costProcessing.ts
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ db/
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ auth/
‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ utils/
‚îú‚îÄ cron/
‚îú‚îÄ Dockerfile
‚îî‚îÄ package.json

title: laundry
description:
üß∫ Project Prompt: Smart Laundry Management System with Customer & Admin Portals

Project Title: Smart Laundry Management System with Customer & Admin Portals

Description:
The Smart Laundry Management System is a web and mobile-based application designed to simplify and modernize laundry services for both customers and administrators. It enables customers to book laundry services, track orders in real time, schedule recurring subscriptions, and manage a digital wardrobe, while providing administrators with business insights, order management, staff allocation, and analytics for better decision-making.

üîπ Customer-Side Features (Mobile/Web App)

User Registration & Login ‚Äì Secure signup via email, phone, or Google/OTP.

Book Order ‚Äì Choose services (Wash & Fold, Wash & Iron, Dry Clean, Eco-Wash), add special instructions, and select pickup/delivery slots.

Real-Time Order Status ‚Äì Notifications for Accepted ‚Üí In-Wash ‚Üí Ready ‚Üí Out for Delivery ‚Üí Delivered.

Recurring/Subscription Orders ‚Äì Auto-book weekly/monthly pickups for regular customers.

Digital Wardrobe ‚Äì Track clothes currently in laundry vs delivered.

Order History ‚Äì Access past orders with downloadable invoices.

Payment Options ‚Äì Online payments (UPI, debit/credit cards, wallets) or Cash on Delivery.

Loyalty & Offers ‚Äì Earn reward points, apply coupons, and enjoy referral bonuses.

Donation Pickup Option ‚Äì Mark old clothes for donation during laundry pickup.

SMS/WhatsApp Bot Booking ‚Äì Book laundry through chatbot without using the app.

Customer Support Chatbot ‚Äì For instant query resolution, FAQs, and live support.

Feedback & Reviews ‚Äì Customers can rate services and share feedback.

üîπ Admin/Business-Side Features (Web Dashboard)

Dashboard Overview ‚Äì Real-time statistics on sales, orders, expenses, and profits.

Graphical charts for Daily, Monthly, and Yearly Sales.

Insights on customer retention and top-used services.

Order Management ‚Äì View, update, and manage all orders; assign delivery staff.

Service Management ‚Äì Add/Edit/Delete services with flexible pricing (per cloth/per kg).

Seasonal packages (e.g., ‚ÄúBlanket Wash Winter Offer‚Äù).

Customer Management ‚Äì Manage registered users, track top-spending customers, and resolve complaints.

Staff & Delivery Management ‚Äì Assign pickup/delivery tasks, track performance, and evaluate efficiency.

Reports & Analytics ‚Äì

Monthly reports for Expenses, Sales, and Profits.

Yearly reports on Growth, Income vs. Expense trends.

Exportable PDF/Excel reports.

Multi-Branch Support ‚Äì Manage multiple laundry outlets under one admin panel.

üëâ Outcome:
This project ensures convenience for customers with easy booking, tracking, and payments, while empowering business owners with complete operational control, financial insights, and customer engagement tools.üß∫ Project Prompt: Smart Laundry Management System with Customer & Admin Portals

Tone: professional, simple, trustworthy. * Primary pages: Founder Dashboard, Plan Submit (create new project), Project Details (private), Investor View (read-only for approved investors), Admin Console. * Key constraints: each project must be private by default ‚Äî founders can invite collaborators or publish a public pitch. No founder can view other founders' project plans unless explicitly invited. * Required components: top navigation with logo + user avatar, left column navigation (collapsible), a card grid for projects, a modal for pitch submission (steps: Basics, Problem, Solution, Go-To-Market, Ask), toast notifications, and a reusable Form component with validation. * Visual: lots of whitespace, readable typography, 2xl rounded cards, soft shadows, accent blue buttons, subtle micro-interactions for hover/focus. Use Tailwind CSS utility classes for layout. Mobile-first responsive layout. * Output: provide Figma-like layout suggestions and Tailwind class names for each major component." * * 2) DEVELOPER PROMPT / BRIEF (copy into issue tracker): * Title: MVP ‚Äî Founder Dashboard + Plan Submit * Stack: React (create-react-app or Vite), Tailwind CSS, optional backend (Node/Express or Firebase/Auth), DB: Firestore/Postgres. * Auth: email/password + OAuth. Roles: founder, investor, admin. * Core features for MVP: * - Secure sign-up / login / role assignment. * - Founder Dashboard: list of founder's projects (cards) + quick create button. * - Plan Submit flow: multi-step submission: Title, Short Pitch, Problem, Solution, Market, Business Model, Ask (funds/equity), Attachments (PDF/images), Visibility (private/invite/public). * - Project privacy: default PRIVATE (only owner + invited collaborators and approved investors with access). No cross-project browsing. * - Project Details page: shows pitch, attachments, timeline, comments (private), and a "Request Intro" button to contact investor (email/in-app message). * - Admin panel: approve/reject investor access requests, manage categories/tags. * * 3) PAGES & BUTTONS (suggested): * Pages: * 1. Landing / Home (marketing + login) * 2. Sign up / Login * 3. Founder Dashboard (my projects) * 4. Plan Submit (multi-step wizard) * 5. Project Details (owner view) * 6. Investor Dashboard (approved projects only) * 7. Admin Console * * Buttons & Actions: * - New Project (primary) * - Submit / Save Draft / Publish * - Invite Collaborator * - Request Access (investor) * - Approve Access (admin) * - Download Pitch Deck * - Edit Project * - Archive / Delete (owner) * * 4) USER STORIES (short): * - As a Founder, I can create a private project plan and save it as draft. * - As a Founder, I can invite specific collaborators to view/edit my project. * - As an Investor, I can request access to view a private project; the founder will approve/deny. * - As Admin, I can moderate published pitches and manage user roles. * * 5) PRIVACY RULES (MUST): * - Projects default to PRIVATE. * - Only the owner and explicitly invited collaborators can view or edit. * - Sharing generates a secure invite link with expiry (optional). * - Searching or browsing other founders' projects is disabled unless the project is published. * * 6) TAILWIND THEME TOKENS (suggested): * - Primary Blue: #1e40af (use as --color-primary) * - Accent / CTA: #2563eb * - Surface / Card: bg-white, ring-1 with subtle shadow * - Radius: rounded-2xl for cards, rounded-md for inputs * - Spacing: use container widths, p-6, gap-4 * * 7) COMPONENT SKELETONS (JSX/Tailwind ready) * - TopNav, SideNav, ProjectCard, MultiStepForm, Modal, Toast * * --- * Below are very short copy prompts for microcopy inside the app (labels, placeholders): * - Project title placeholder: "E.g. CleanCharge ‚Äî portable EV charger for apartments" * - Short pitch: "Explain your idea in one sentence (25‚Äì140 chars)" * - Ask: "How much funding do you need? (‚Çπ / $) and what equity are you offering?" * - Visibility toggle: "Private ‚Äî Only invited collaborators can view" / "Public ‚Äî Visible to approved investors" * - Button: Primary: "Create project" / Secondary: "Save draft" */ export default function SharkTankPrompts() { return (

title: Textile support with open cv
description:
To empower users with textile knowledge and personalized fashion guidance by combining camera-based skin tone analysis with fabric recommendations, color matching, and wardrobe planning.

üîç Key Features
1. Skin Tone Scanner
- Uses the camera to analyze the user's skin tone and undertone.
- Categorizes users into tone profiles (e.g., warm olive, cool porcelain, neutral brown).
- Suggests color palettes that complement their tone.
2. Fabric Matcher
- Recommends textiles that suit the user‚Äôs skin sensitivity, climate, and style.
- Offers insights into fabric texture, breathability, and sustainability.
- Suggests alternatives for allergies or preferences (e.g., cotton vs bamboo vs modal).
3. Wardrobe Visualizer
- Users can scan their clothes to build a digital wardrobe.
- App tags each item by color, fabric, and suitability for skin tone.
- Highlights which items enhance the user‚Äôs appearance and which clash.
4. Smart Styling Suggestions
- Suggests outfits based on skin tone, occasion, and weather.
- Offers layering tips, fabric combinations, and seasonal trends.
- Integrates with local textile stores or online platforms for sourcing.
5. Textile Education Hub
- Teaches users about different fabrics, their origins, care instructions, and ethical sourcing.
- Includes video tutorials, care guides, and textile history.

title: Netflix clone webapp/Webpage
description:
Sure üëç ‚Äî here‚Äôs how your **Netflix Clone Website** would look and feel when described like a real webpage, not just code or architecture üëá

---

## üé¨ **Netflix Clone ‚Äì Stream Your Favorite Movies and Shows**

### üåê **Website Overview**

This Netflix clone is a modern, responsive web application designed to deliver a smooth, cinematic streaming experience ‚Äî just like Netflix.
Built using **Next.js**, **Tailwind CSS**, and **React Player**, it lets users explore movies, watch trailers, and enjoy full-length videos (from your own uploaded content).

---

### üè† **Home Page (Browse)**

* Clean, dark-themed interface inspired by Netflix‚Äôs classic look.
* Large **hero banner** at the top featuring a trending movie with a "Play" and "More Info" button.
* Below it, multiple **horizontal carousels** like:

  * Trending Now
  * Top Rated
  * New Releases
  * Watch Again
* Each movie tile shows a poster image, title on hover, and quick actions.

üß≠ **Navigation Bar**:

* Netflix-style sticky navbar with logo on the left.
* Menu links: *Home*, *Movies*, *Series*, *My List*.
* Profile icon on the right for account settings and logout.

---

### üé• **Movie Detail Page**

* When you click on a movie card, it opens a dedicated page.
* Displays the **movie poster**, **title**, **rating**, **year**, **genre**, and a **‚ÄúPlay Now‚Äù** button.
* A full **description** of the film appears below, along with similar movie recommendations.
* Uses `react-player` (or HLS.js) for smooth video playback inside the browser.

---

### üë§ **User Authentication**

* **Sign Up / Log In** pages with clean forms.
* Password hashing for security.
* Once logged in, users can create **‚ÄúMy List‚Äù**, see their watch history, and continue watching from where they left off.

---

### üí≥ **Subscription Page**

* Integrated **Stripe payment gateway** for easy subscriptions.
* Plans: *Basic*, *Standard*, *Premium* (just like Netflix).
* Users with active plans can access the streaming content instantly.

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è **Admin Dashboard (optional)**

* Admin can log in and:

  * Add or remove movies
  * Upload video URLs or HLS manifests
  * Update posters, genres, and tags
  * Monitor active users and subscriptions

---

### üì± **Responsive Design**

* Fully optimized for **mobile, tablet, and desktop**.
* Adaptive grids and carousels ensure seamless browsing on any device.

---

### üíæ **Tech Behind the Scenes**

| Layer      | Technology                          |
| ---------- | ----------------------------------- |
| Frontend   | Next.js (React), Tailwind CSS       |
| Player     | React Player / HLS.js               |
| Backend    | Node.js + Express / Next API routes |
| Database   | MongoDB or PostgreSQL               |
| Auth       | NextAuth / JWT                      |
| Payments   | Stripe                              |
| Deployment | Vercel / AWS / Render               |

---

### üåà **User Experience Summary**

When a user visits the Netflix Clone site:

1. They land on a **visually rich homepage** showing trending titles.
2. After signing up or logging in, they can browse categories or search for specific movies.
3. Clicking on a movie opens the **detail page** where they can watch instantly.
4. The video player loads with smooth transitions, subtitles, and playback options.
5. Users can add movies to ‚ÄúMy List,‚Äù view history, and explore personalized recommendations.
