title: AR Based Heritage App
description:
1. Project Overview

The app is a mobile Augmented Reality (AR) platform designed to digitally preserve and showcase heritage temples.
Our pilot implementation is Chennimalai Murugan Temple in Tamil Nadu, but the framework is scalable for any temple/heritage site in India.

The app combines React Native (frontend), Unity + AR Foundation (AR engine), and Firebase or Aws  (backend/cloud) to deliver immersive 3D temple experiences.
It is designed for urban + rural users, with offline-first functionality and multilingual support.


---

2. Target Users

Tourists visiting temples (need guided AR info).

Students/Researchers studying temple architecture & history.

Local devotees who want temple stories in their native language.

Government & NGOs who want scalable heritage preservation.



---

3. Core Features

A. User Experience

1. Home Screen

Simple UI with temple name, logo, and ‚ÄúEnter AR Mode‚Äù button.

Options for language selection (English + Tamil, scalable to more).



2. Temple Info Section

Text + audio narrations of history, legends, and architecture.

Photos & videos for quick learning.



3. AR Mode

Live camera + AR overlay.

When pointed at a marker (image / QR code / temple object), the 3D temple model or statue appears.

Users can rotate, zoom, and explore.



4. Interactive Hotspots

Tap on a shrine/idol ‚Üí show popup with history, significance, audio guide.

Example: Tap ‚ÄúKoti Maram‚Äù ‚Üí popup: ‚ÄúThis is the historic temple flagpole used in annual Panguni Uthiram festival.‚Äù



5. Offline Mode

Users can download temple assets (3D models, audio) in advance.

Cached for offline usage ‚Üí very useful in rural areas.

-

B. Backend + Admin Features

1. Firebase Storage

Store 3D temple models (GLTF/GLB with Draco compression).

Store images, descriptions, audio narrations.


2. Admin Dashboard (future scope)

Upload new temple data.

Push updates to app users.



3. Analytics

Track which temples/features are most used.

Useful for scaling project.


---

4. Technical Design

A. Frontend (React Native)

Cross-platform mobile app (Android + iOS).

Handles navigation, offline storage, multilingual UI.

Integrates Unity AR module via React Native bridge.


B. AR Module (Unity + AR Foundation)

Uses ARCore (Android) and ARKit (iOS).

Supports marker-based AR (scanning temple image/QR to show 3D).

Optimized rendering with Draco compression (reduces 3D size by 70%).


C. Backend (Firebase or AWS choose only which have more free tier)

Firebase Authentication ‚Üí optional for login.

Firebase Storage ‚Üí 3D models, temple data.

Realtime Database ‚Üí manage temple metadata.

Firestore Caching ‚Üí offline-first.



---

5. Workflow (Step by Step)

1. User opens app ‚Üí selects temple ‚Üí downloads assets.


2. User points camera ‚Üí AR loads 3D model of temple/statue.


3. Tap hotspots ‚Üí show history/story cards with audio.


4. Assets stored locally ‚Üí app works offline.


5. Firebase updates automatically sync when online.


6. Unique Selling Points

Works in low-bandwidth rural areas (offline mode).

Supports multiple languages (Tamil + English now, expandable).

Lightweight & optimized 3D models (low storage).

Scalable ‚Üí more temples can be added via backend.

Educational + Devotional value ‚Üí tourists + students + locals.


7. Future Scope

AI-generated narrations in multiple languages.

VR mode for full temple walkthrough.

Blockchain-based authenticity for heritage preservation.

Integration with government tourism apps.

title: crprints
description:
CR Prints Web App is a complete printing order management system built for printing and designing businesses. It helps track the full lifecycle of a client‚Äôs order ‚Äî from receiving an inquiry to final delivery.

The app supports two types of users:

Admin (shop owner/staff) ‚Üí Manage customers, create and update orders, track status, handle payments, and manage deliveries.

Client (customers) ‚Üí Login with mobile number and password to track their orders, view payment details, and receive updates.

Core Features:

Authentication

Admin login with email/username & password.

Client login with mobile number & password.

Customer Management

Search by mobile number.

If customer exists ‚Üí show details.

If new ‚Üí add name & number.

WhatsApp and Call buttons for instant communication.

Order Management

Admin can create orders with type (visiting card, flex, banner, invitation, etc.) and optional description.

Option to enable delivery with delivery address, receiver name & mobile.

Orders automatically appear in Today‚Äôs Orders list on the dashboard.

Automatic WhatsApp notifications when an order is created or status changes.

Order Status Tracking

Status flow: Created ‚Üí Designed ‚Üí Printing ‚Üí Printed & Received ‚Üí Delivered.

Delivered orders move automatically to History.

Realtime updates visible on the dashboard.

Dashboard

Admin Dashboard: View all active orders, filter by status, track payments, manage deliveries.

Client Dashboard: Customers can see their own orders, status updates, and payments.

Payments

Track total price, advance, partial, or full payments.

Remaining balance auto-calculated.

Payment status badge: Paid, Part Paid, or Not Paid.

Delivery Module

If delivery is enabled, capture delivery location and receiver details.

Show delivery orders separately.

Notifications

WhatsApp notifications to customers when:

Order is created.

Status changes (Designed, Printing, Delivered).

Benefits:

Reduces manual tracking and confusion.

Improves client satisfaction with transparency.

Saves time with quick WhatsApp communication.

Provides clear payment and delivery tracking.
additionalNotes:
üé® Design Style 1. Minimal Keep layouts clean & spacious (lots of white space / off-white). Use one bold primary color + subtle accents. Typography: modern sans-serif like Inter, Poppins, or Manrope. 2. Glassmorphism Transparent cards with blur effects. Example style: background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.15); backdrop-filter: blur(12px); border-radius: 16px; border: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2); Works best on dashboards, order cards, and modals. 3. Neumorphism Soft shadows to make buttons & inputs look pressed/raised. Example style: background: #f3f4f6; border-radius: 12px; box-shadow: 6px 6px 12px #d1d5db, -6px -6px 12px #ffffff; Use for status buttons, toggle switches, and client login cards. üé® Color Theme (Minimal Premium) Primary: Deep Navy #0F172A Secondary (Accent): Gold #FACC15 Danger/Alert: Coral Red #F43F5E Background Light: #F9FAFB (almost white) Background Dark: #111827 (for dark mode glass effect) Text Primary: #1F2937 Text Secondary: #6B7280 ‚ú® Example UI Elements Dashboard Cards (Glassmorphism): Semi-transparent, blurred background with glowing border. Buttons (Neumorphism): Raised soft-shadow buttons with hover ‚Äúpressed-in‚Äù effect. Order Status Badges: Rounded pill with subtle gradient: Created ‚Üí Gray Designed ‚Üí Blue Printing ‚Üí Gold Printed & Received ‚Üí Green Delivered ‚Üí Purple üîß Tailwind Setup (with Glass + Neumorphism utilities) In tailwind.config.js extend utilities: theme: { extend: { colors: { primary: "#0F172A", secondary: "#FACC15", danger: "#F43F5E", lightbg: "#F9FAFB", darkbg: "#111827", }, boxShadow: { neumorph: "6px 6px 12px #d1d5db, -6px -6px 12px #ffffff", neumorphInset: "inset 6px 6px 12px #d1d5db, inset -6px -6px 12px #ffffff", }, backdropBlur: { xs: "2px", md: "12px", }, }, } Usage Example:

Today's Orders

üëâ This way, your app will have a minimal base with glassmorphism for cards/panels and neumorphism for interactive controls.

title: LCA
description:
AI-Powered Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) Platform - Complete Workflow

## 1. User Authentication & Onboarding
- **Registration**: New users create an account with email, name, company, and role (metallurgist, engineer, decision-maker)
- **Login**: Secure authentication with role-based access control
- **Onboarding Tutorial**: Interactive guide showing platform features and capabilities
- **Workspace Setup**: Users create or join organizational workspaces for collaboration

## 2. Project Creation & Setup
- **New Project**: User creates a new LCA project with name, description, and metal type
- **System Boundary Selection**: Define what processes to include in the assessment
- **Goal & Scope Definition**: Set objectives, functional units, and impact categories
- **Template Selection**: Choose from pre-configured templates for common metal processes

## 3. Data Input Process
### Primary Data Collection:
- **Process Selection**: User selects production routes (primary vs. recycled)
- **Material Inputs**: Specify raw materials, quantities, and sources
- **Energy Consumption**: Enter energy types and amounts for each process stage
- **Transportation Data**: Input transport modes, distances, and frequencies
- **Water Usage**: Document water consumption and sources
- **Emissions Data**: Enter known emission values
- **Waste Generation**: Specify waste types and treatment methods
- **End-of-Life Options**: Define recycling rates, disposal methods, etc.

### Data Input Methods:
- **Manual Forms**: Structured forms for direct data entry
- **File Upload**: Support for Excel, CSV, and other industry-standard formats
- **API Integration**: Connection to existing enterprise systems (ERP, MES)
- **Historical Data**: Access to previous project data for reference

## 4. AI-Assisted Data Completion
- **Missing Data Detection**: System identifies gaps in the inventory data
- **Intelligent Estimation**: AI models suggest values based on:
  - Similar processes in database
  - Industry benchmarks
  - Physical and chemical relationships
  - Historical patterns
- **Uncertainty Quantification**: AI provides confidence intervals for estimates
- **Explanation Feature**: AI explains rationale for each estimation

## 5. LCA Calculation & Analysis
- **Impact Assessment**: System calculates environmental impacts across categories:
  - Global Warming Potential (carbon footprint)
  - Water Consumption
  - Resource Depletion
  - Human Toxicity
  - Ecotoxicity
  - Other relevant impact categories
- **Circularity Assessment**: Evaluation of circular economy indicators:
  - Material Circularity Indicator (MCI)
  - Recycling rates
  - Resource efficiency
  - Waste valorization potential
- **Hotspot Identification**: AI pinpoints processes with highest environmental impact

## 6. Visualization & Interpretation
- **Interactive Dashboard**: Real-time visualization of results with:
  - Impact category charts (bar, radar, pie charts)
  - Process contribution analysis
  - Geographic distribution of impacts
  - Time-series analysis for temporal trends
- **Comparative Analysis**: Side-by-side comparison of different scenarios
- **Drill-Down Capability**: Click any data point to see underlying calculations
- **Material Flow Diagram**: Visual representation of inputs, outputs, and flows

## 7. Scenario Modeling & Optimization
- **What-If Analysis**: Users modify parameters to test alternative scenarios:
  - Change energy sources
  - Adjust recycling rates
  - Modify transport modes
  - Implement new technologies
- **Optimization Suggestions**: AI recommends improvements based on:
  - Cost-environment tradeoffs
  - Technical feasibility
  - Regulatory constraints
- **Sensitivity Analysis**: Understand which parameters most affect results
- **Circular Economy Pathways**: Explore strategies to close material loops

## 8. Reporting & Export
- **Automated Report Generation**: Comprehensive reports with:
  - Executive summary
  - Methodology description
  - Detailed results
  - Hotspot analysis
  - Improvement opportunities
  - Uncertainty assessment
- **Customization Options**: Tailor reports to different stakeholders
- **Export Formats**: PDF, Excel, Word, and industry-standard formats (ILCD)
- **Sharing & Collaboration**: Secure sharing with team members and stakeholders

## 9. AI Chatbot Assistance
- **Contextual Help**: Get assistance specific to the current task
- **Regulatory Guidance**: Information on compliance requirements
- **Methodology Explanations**: Clarification on LCA concepts and calculations
- **Best Practices**: Recommendations based on industry standards
- **Troubleshooting**: Help with technical issues or interpretation challenges

## 10. Administration & Management
- **User Management**: Admin controls for user roles and permissions
- **Data Governance**: Quality control, versioning, and audit trails
- **Template Management**: Create and modify process templates
- **System Configuration**: Customize impact assessment methods and factors
- **Usage Analytics**: Monitor platform engagement and value delivered

## 11. Continuous Improvement
- **Feedback Mechanism**: Users can provide input on AI suggestions
- **Learning System**: AI improves over time with more data and user feedback
- **Database Updates**: Regular updates of background databases and factors
- **Feature Updates**: New capabilities added based on user needs

## 12. Integration Ecosystem
- **Third-Party Databases**: Connection to commercial LCA databases
- **ERP/MES Integration**: Bidirectional data exchange with enterprise systems
- **API Access**: Programmatic access for advanced users and integrators
- **Digital Twin Connection**: Integration with plant simulation systems

## User Journey Example: Metallurgist Evaluating a New Aluminum Process
1. Logs in and creates "New Aluminum Smelting Process" project
2. Selects system boundary from mining to semi-fabricated product
3. Inputs known data on alumina consumption, energy use, and process emissions
4. AI suggests values for ancillary materials and transportation based on similar processes
5. Runs LCA calculation and reviews results on dashboard
6. Notices high carbon footprint from electricity source
7. Uses scenario modeling to test switching to renewable energy
8. AI recommends specific improvements with estimated impact reduction
9. Generates report comparing current and improved process
10. Shares findings with sustainability team for decision-making

This comprehensive workflow enables users to conduct rigorous LCAs with AI assistance, identify improvement opportunities, and make data-driven decisions to enhance sustainability and circularity in metal production.

title: Spotify
description:
Create a Spotify-like mobile music app with the following requirements:

1. Frontend (HTML, CSS, JavaScript):

Bottom navigation bar with buttons: Home, Search, Library, Create.

Music player controls: Play/Pause, Next (forward), Previous (back), Speed control (0.75x, 1x, 1.25x, 1.5x).

Home page should display Profile button.

Profile section should include: Create Account, Recents, What‚Äôs New, Settings.

Settings page should include: Current Account, Content & Display, Playback, Private & Social, Notifications, Apps & Devices, Data Save & Offline, Media Quality, About & Support, and Logout.

On profile right side: buttons for All, Music, Podcasts.

All button shows all music (shared with friends).

Music button shows music grouped under correct movie profiles with track listings.




2. Library Feature:

Any music can be liked and stored in the library.

Liked music can be added to an existing playlist or a new playlist.



3. Search Feature:

Search by music name or movie name.

Show results and allow play or like.



4. Backend (Java, Spring Boot):

Handle authentication, tracks, playlists, likes, and search.

Provide REST APIs for all above features.



5. Database (MySQL):

Store users, tracks, playlists, likes.

Import old music into the new tracks database.



6. Authentication & Login Page:

New users can register with username, email or mobile number, password.

Include SMS verification for account activation.

Login and registration details stored in MySQL.

title: Certificate bulk generator

It‚Äôs a Java project.

You upload a certificate template (image/PDF).

You upload a name list (CSV/Excel).

The tool generates certificates in bulk by placing names onto the template.

It uploads generated certificates to Google Drive.

It has a user interface (you mentioned wanting a UI).

It stores each generated certificate (you wanted persistence).


Want me to do one of these next:

1. Provide a complete Java example (uses Apache PDFBox / iText) that reads CSV and stamps names onto a PDF template.


2. Show Google Drive API integration code and OAuth steps to upload files.


3. Build a simple desktop UI (JavaFX or Swing) to select template & list and run the job.


4. Give a web UI (single-file React or simple Spring Boot + Thymeleaf) approach.


5. Create a ready-to-run script (Java + build file, sample template, sample CSV).


6. Help design the certificate template (placement coordinates, fonts, export options).

title: Village exports
description:
Project Title:

Village Experts

Abstract / Idea:

Tagline: ‚ÄúYour Market, Your Price.‚Äù

It‚Äôs a mobile app for farmers to get:

Real-time crop prices from nearby markets

Accurate market rates

Weather updates

Crop advisory in local languages


Features:

GPS-based market suggestions

Voice support

Simple interface

Bridge between farmers and fair pricing



Software Requirements:

Tech stack:

Android Studio

Java/Kotlin

Firebase (backend, authentication, or database)


Concept:

Market-based system, not just a tool but a smart companion for farmers‚Äô growth.
additionalNotes:
Flow Steps:

1. Start


2. Open Village Experts App


3. User selects language ‚Üí (Login or Skip)


4. Allow Location Access?

Yes ‚Üí Fetch nearby market via GPS

No ‚Üí Ask user to select market manually



5. Fetch market prices (via API)


6. Display crop price list


7. User clicks on crop for details


8. Show additional insights:

Price trends

Best market suggestions

Weather forecast

Crop tips



9. Save data for offline view


10. End




---

Analysis & Strengths

‚úÖ Good focus on farmers‚Äô real needs (prices, weather, advice, local language).
‚úÖ Offline view is a smart feature (since rural areas may lack stable internet).
‚úÖ Flowchart is clear and systematic ‚Äî shows real-world use cases.
‚úÖ Includes voice support + GPS, which helps farmers with limited literacy.


---

Possible Improvements

1. Security: Add farmer authentication (via phone number or OTP).


2. Data Source: Mention which APIs (government mandi boards, weather APIs).


3. Scalability: Add support for market demand prediction (ML model later).


4. UI Simplicity: Use icons + local languages for easy adoption.


5. Extra Features:

Price alerts (SMS/notification when crop price changes).

Community forum (farmers can share knowledge).

Government scheme updates.

Register

Profile Page

Notifications

title: AyurWell
description:
Platform Context:

Frontend: React Native (iOS/Android) + PWA

Backend: Microservices (Node.js & FastAPI)

Blockchain: Hybrid Polygon/Ethereum L2 + Hyperledger Fabric

AI/ML: LLaMA-3 8B fine-tuned for Ayurveda + specialized vision & NLP models

Database: Encrypted PostgreSQL + Redis caching

Cloud: GCP/AWS with Indian data residency compliance

Security & Compliance:

Authentication: DIDs + MFA (TOTP, biometric)

Privacy: GDPR, HIPAA, DPDP Act 2023, DISHA

Consent: Granular, blockchain-recorded patient sharing

Audit: Immutable logging of all critical actions

Roles & Capabilities:

Patient Mode:

Prakriti assessment (95%+ accuracy)

Vikriti analysis from symptoms, photos, voice

AI meal recognition & logging (text/photo/voice)

Personalized dosha-based diet, lifestyle, routines

Herb-drug interaction alerts

Secure teleconsultations

Biometric integration (sleep, heart rate)

Seasonal & regional customization

Offline-first edge AI for basic assessments

Voice logging in major Indian languages

Emergency triage + instant escalation

Practitioner Mode:

Panchamahabhuta & Tridosha case analysis

Evidence-based treatment protocols (classical + modern)

AI image analysis (tongue, pulse, skin)

Automated diet & herb plan creation

Digital prescriptions with blockchain verification

Progress tracking & analytics

Credential management on blockchain

Secure patient data access via consent

Teleconsultation tools & educational insights

Clinic Admin Mode:

Multi-practitioner scheduling & resource optimization

Patient flow management & reminders

Blockchain audit trails for compliance

Revenue & performance dashboards

Role-based permission controls

Assessment Framework:

Prakriti (constitutional):

Physical, physiological, psychological, behavioral, genetic factors

Multi-modal input (text, voice, image) + confidence scoring

Seasonal & regional adaptation

Vikriti (current state):

Symptom intelligence (multi-language)

Image & biometric analysis

Environmental & lifestyle factors

Intelligent triage: CRITICAL/URGENT/MODERATE/ROUTINE/PREVENTIVE

Agni assessment:

Sama, Vishama, Tikshna, Manda, Jatharagni classifications

Recommendation Engine:

Ahara: Rasa, Guna, Virya, Prabhava + regional recipes + circadian timing

Vihara: Dinacharya, Ritucharya, exercise, sleep, stress management

Aushadha: Personalized herb formulations, dosage, monitoring, safety alerts

Blockchain Features:

DIDs for self-sovereign identity

Smart contracts: Identity, Consent, Audit, Treatment

Patient data lockers with time-bound, revocable consent

Multilingual & Cultural Intelligence:

Languages: Hindi, English, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, Bengali, Gujarati, Marathi, Punjabi

Context-aware translation, voice recognition, Sanskrit integration, cultural adaptation

Emergency & Safety:

Automated alerts for critical vitals & medication interactions

Clear escalation protocols for life-threatening, severe, moderate, routine cases

Continuous Learning:

Federated learning, clinician feedback, outcome tracking, research updates

Pre-interaction checks: blockchain auth, consent validation, medical accuracy, cultural sensitivity, audit trail

Response Formats:

Patient:

text
Constitutional Assessment: [dosha % breakdown with visuals]
Current Health Status: [vikriti analysis & severity]
Immediate Recommendations: [actionable steps & timeline]
Wellness Plan: [lifestyle modifications & tracking]
Safety: [risk factors & when to seek help]
Next Steps: [follow-up & practitioner consultation]
Practitioner:

text
Case Summary: [profile & key indicators]
Clinical Support: [evidence-based recommendations]
Treatment Protocol: [dosage, timing, monitoring]
Risk Assessment: [contraindications & interactions]
Progress Metrics: [objective & subjective measures]
Collaboration: [referrals & specialist input]
Admin:

text
Overview: [clinic metrics & utilization]
Compliance: [regulatory & audit status]
Performance: [productivity & satisfaction]
Security: [access logs & consent status]
Health: [system & model performance]
Integration:

Aadhaar Health ID, ABDM, labs, pharmacies, insurance

FHIR, WHO coding, global research networks

Always prioritize patient safety, professional boundaries, cultural respect, data privacy, and blockchain-verified trust. Serve as a powerful companion to human expertise, not a replacement.

title: codelens
description: assistant
additionalNotes:
Create a modern, professional AI chat interface called "CodeLens" - a developer knowledge assistant powered by RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation).

## Application Overview
CodeLens is an intelligent chatbot that helps developers get instant answers about frameworks like FastAPI, LangChain, and Pydantic by querying a custom knowledge base via API.

## Design Style
- **Theme**: Dark mode with cyberpunk/developer aesthetic
- **Colors**: 
  - Primary: Electric blue (#00D9FF)
  - Secondary: Purple gradient (#8B5CF6 to #6366F1)
  - Background: Dark navy/black (#0A0E27, #1A1D35)
  - Text: White (#FFFFFF) and light gray (#E5E7EB)
  - Accent: Neon green (#10B981) for success states
- **Typography**: Modern sans-serif (Inter or Geist)
- **Style**: Clean, minimal, with subtle glassmorphism effects

## Core Features & Layout

### 1. Main Chat Interface
- **Header Section** (fixed top):
  - App logo "üß† CodeLens" on the left
  - Subtitle: "AI Developer Assistant"
  - Knowledge base status indicator (shows number of documents indexed)
  - Settings/Admin panel button (top right)
  
- **Chat Container** (scrollable middle section):
  - Messages displayed in conversation format
  - User messages: right-aligned, blue gradient background
  - AI messages: left-aligned, dark card with subtle border
  - Each AI message should show:
    - Avatar icon (robot/AI icon)
    - The answer text (with markdown support)
    - "Sources" section (collapsible) showing:
      - Source name
      - Relevance score (as percentage)
      - Text preview (first 100 chars)
    - Timestamp
  - Smooth auto-scroll to latest message
  - Loading indicator with animated dots when waiting for response

- **Input Section** (fixed bottom):
  - Large text input field with placeholder: "Ask about FastAPI, LangChain, Pydantic..."
  - Send button (icon: paper airplane)
  - Character counter
  - Example prompts as chips/pills above input (clickable):
    - "What is FastAPI?"
    - "How to use LangChain?"
    - "Explain Pydantic models"

### 2. Admin/Settings Panel (Sidebar or Modal)
Accessible via button in header. Contains:

**Knowledge Base Management:**
- Section title: "üìö Knowledge Base"
- Current stats card showing:
  - Total documents
  - Total chunks
  - Last updated timestamp
- "Add Documentation" section with tabs:
  
  **Tab 1: Web Scraping**
  - Input field for single URL
  - "Scrape URL" button
  - OR
  - Predefined sources dropdown:
    - FastAPI Documentation
    - LangChain Documentation
    - Pydantic Documentation
  - "Update Selected" button
  - Progress indicator when scraping
  
  **Tab 2: PDF Upload**
  - Drag-and-drop zone for PDF files
  - File size limit indicator (max 10MB)
  - Upload button
  - List of uploaded PDFs with delete option
  
  **Tab 3: Manual Entry**
  - Large text area for pasting documentation
  - Source name input field
  - "Add to Knowledge Base" button

**Settings:**
- "Top K Results" slider (1-10, default 3)
- "Model" dropdown (show: llama-3.1-70b-versatile)
- "Clear All Data" button (with confirmation modal)

### 3. Welcome Screen (shown when chat is empty)
- Large centered hero section:
  - Animated CodeLens logo
  - Headline: "Welcome to CodeLens"
  - Subheading: "Your AI-powered developer knowledge assistant"
  - Feature cards grid (3 columns):
    1. "‚ö° Instant Answers" - Get precise answers from your documentation
    2. "üîÑ Always Updated" - Automatically syncs with latest docs
    3. "üìö Multiple Sources" - Query across frameworks seamlessly
  - Suggested questions as large clickable cards

## API Integration

Backend is FastAPI running at: http://127.0.0.1:8000

### Endpoints to integrate:

**1. POST /ask**
Request body:
{
  "query": "user's question here",
  "top_k": 3
}

Response:
{
  "answer": "AI generated answer",
  "sources": [
    {
      "source": "FastAPI Documentation",
      "score": 0.89,
      "text_preview": "preview text..."
    }
  ],
  "context_used": true,
  "model": "llama-3.1-70b-versatile"
}

**2. GET /collection_info**
Returns:
{
  "name": "codelens_docs",
  "vectors_count": 150,
  "points_count": 150,
  "status": "healthy"
}

**3. POST /update_from_url**
Request: { "url": "https://example.com" }
Response: operation status with chunks_added count

**4. POST /update_predefined/{source}**
Where source = "fastapi" | "langchain" | "pydantic"
Returns: background task started confirmation

**5. POST /upload_pdf**
Multipart form data with file
Returns: chunks_added and status

**6. POST /add_document**
Request: { "text": "...", "source": "..." }
Returns: chunks_added count

**7. GET /available_sources**
Returns list of predefined documentation sources

## Technical Requirements

**Frontend Stack:**
- React 18+ with TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Use React Query for API calls
- Markdown rendering library (react-markdown) for AI responses
- Framer Motion for animations
- Lucide React for icons
- Toast notifications for success/error states

**State Management:**
- Use React hooks (useState, useEffect)
- Context for theme/settings if needed

**Features to Implement:**
- Real-time typing indicators
- Smooth scroll animations
- Responsive design (mobile-friendly)
- Error handling with user-friendly messages
- Loading states for all async operations
- Keyboard shortcuts (Enter to send, Shift+Enter for new line)
- Copy button for AI responses
- Export chat history button
- Dark/light mode toggle (optional, default dark)

**Code Quality:**
- Clean, modular component structure
- Proper TypeScript types
- Async/await for API calls
- Error boundaries
- Accessible (ARIA labels)

## Component Structure Suggestion


## UI/UX Details

**Animations:**
- Messages fade in from bottom
- Sources expand/collapse with smooth transition
- Typing indicator: three bouncing dots
- Success: green checkmark with scale animation
- Error: red shake animation

**Micro-interactions:**
- Button hover effects (scale 1.05)
- Input focus: blue glow effect
- Card hover: subtle lift with shadow
- Smooth color transitions on all interactive elements

**Empty States:**
- "No sources found" - show suggestion to add documentation
- "No messages yet" - show welcome screen
- "Loading..." - show skeleton screens

**Error Handling:**
- Network error: "Can't connect to server. Make sure backend is running."
- API error: Show error message from backend
- Timeout: "Request took too long. Try again."
- Toast notifications for background operations (scraping, uploads)

## Mobile Responsiveness
- Stack header vertically on small screens
- Full-width messages
- Bottom sheet for admin panel instead of sidebar
- Touch-friendly button sizes (min 44px)
- Collapsible source sections

## Additional Features (Nice to Have)
- Syntax highlighting for code in responses
- Regenerate answer button
- Thumbs up/down for feedback
- Search through chat history
- Save favorite responses
- Share conversation link
- Voice input (optional)

Build this as a single-page application with production-ready code quality.

title: StayEase ‚Äì Online Hotel Booking and Room Management Portal
description:
Build me a complete college final year project titled StayEase ‚Äì Online Hotel Booking and Room Management Portal. The project should be developed using Core Java for backend logic and Fetch API with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for the frontend. Data should be managed in-memory using Java collections or simple file handling (no external databases). The system must clearly reflect the Existing System and the Proposed System functionalities as follows:

Existing System (Current Scenario):

Hotel reservations are usually handled manually or through phone/email.

Customers cannot instantly check real-time room availability.

Managing bookings, cancellations, or changes is time-consuming and error-prone.

Hotel staff need to maintain physical records or spreadsheets, leading to inefficiency.

Proposed System (StayEase Portal):

A web-based portal where customers can directly check room availability online.

Customers can book rooms, cancel reservations, and view booking history instantly.

Hotels can list room details, pricing, and availability dynamically.

A responsive frontend UI with features like form validation, dark mode toggle, search filter, and booking confirmation alerts.

Java backend REST-like APIs to handle room data, user sessions, and booking transactions, consumed via Fetch API.

Smooth animations, clear navigation, and modern UX practices for better user experience.

Modules to Implement:

User Module ‚Äì Login/Signup, Profile Management, View & Manage Bookings.

Hotel Module ‚Äì Room Listing, Availability Check, Pricing & Details.

Booking Module ‚Äì Online Room Booking, Cancellation, Reservation History.

Deliverables Required:

Beginner-friendly Java backend code with proper comments.

A modern frontend UI built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Fetch API examples showing clear interaction between frontend & backend.

A detailed README file with step-by-step execution instructions.

Optional advanced features: date-based booking validation, search & filter for rooms, confirmation pop-ups.

title: Progova
description:
To tracking a student Progress from starting of the course to completion of the course 

Progova is a student management and placement assistance system that provides a unified platform for administrators and students to interact effectively. The system begins with a secure login where students can access their home page using their ID and password, while administrators log in to manage student-related activities. The admin module allows functionalities such as adding new students, maintaining attendance records, managing placement details, collecting feedback from students, and sending important messages or announcements. On the other hand, the student module provides access to features like viewing attendance, checking placement opportunities, tracking academic progress through the course timeline, and submitting feedback to improve services. Students also receive timely notifications regarding academics, events, and placements, ensuring they stay updated. Additional pages such as About and Contact are included to provide general information and support. By integrating academic tracking, communication, and placement management into a single system, Progova reduces manual effort, enhances transparency, and improves the overall learning and placement experience for both students and administrators.

title: A Multi-Agent Context-Aware Access Control and Cryptographic Framework for Secure Cloud-Based EHR Systems Using Trusted Third Parties
description:
Detailed Working Flow (Start ‚Üí End)
1. System Setup & Initialization

Admin (Trusted Third Party ‚Äì TTP) initializes the system:

Creates users (patients, doctors, admins) in MongoDB.

Defines role-based permissions (patient, doctor, admin).

Sets up RESTful Flask APIs for registration, authentication, encryption, access requests, and logging.

Prepares encryption module with Fernet for per-file encryption.

Configures JWT authentication for secure token-based login.

2. User Registration

A new Patient or Doctor registers:

Submits details (name, email, role, password).

Password is hashed with Werkzeug before storing in MongoDB.

User account stored in MongoDB with role = "patient" or "doctor".

TTP oversees registration and validates identity.

3. User Authentication

Login flow:

Patient/Doctor sends email + password.

Flask verifies with MongoDB.

If valid ‚Üí generates a JWT token (with expiry, role, and userID).

JWT returned to user ‚Üí used in all future API calls.

Ensures session-less, stateless authentication.

4. EHR Data Upload by Patient

Patient logs in with JWT ‚Üí uploads EHR file.

Process:

Flask generates a unique Fernet key for that file.

File encrypted using Fernet (AES-128 + HMAC).

Encrypted file and Fernet key stored in MongoDB.

Metadata saved: fileID, patientID, timestamp.

(Optional) Fernet keys are revocable by TTP later.

5. Patient Policy Definition

Patient defines context-aware policies:

Example:

Allow Dr. A to access cardiology records only.

Allow Dr. B only during treatment period (date range).

Deny access after revocation.

Policies stored in MongoDB:

{
  "patientID": "123",
  "doctorID": "456",
  "fileID": "789",
  "conditions": {
    "role": "doctor",
    "time": "9AM-5PM",
    "valid_until": "2025-12-31"
  }
}


Patients can update or revoke access dynamically.

6. Doctor EHR Access Request

Doctor logs in with JWT ‚Üí requests patient‚Äôs file.

API call: /access-request?fileID=789&patientID=123

Workflow:

Flask validates JWT (role = doctor).

Checks policy pipeline:

Role-based validation ‚úÖ

Patient‚Äôs policy rules ‚úÖ

TTP approval if required ‚úÖ

If allowed:

Fernet key is retrieved for that file.

File decrypted ‚Üí returned securely.

If denied:

Error response + access logged as ‚Äúdenied‚Äù.

7. Dynamic Key Revocation (TTP Control)

At any time, TTP (admin) can:

Revoke Fernet key for a patient‚Äôs files.

Even if doctor has valid policy, file becomes unreadable.

Supports emergency key invalidation for data leaks or misuse.

8. Access Logging & Monitoring

Every access attempt (success/denial) logged:

Patient email

Doctor email

Timestamp

Access status (granted/denied)

Processing time (request ‚Üí response)

Example log entry:

{
  "patient": "alice@gmail.com",
  "doctor": "dr.bob@hospital.com",
  "fileID": "789",
  "status": "granted",
  "timestamp": "2025-09-27T10:30:22",
  "processing_time_ms": 250
}


Logs stored in MongoDB for audit trails.

9. Notifications System

When doctor accesses file:

Patient receives an automatic notification:

‚ÄúDr. Bob accessed your cardiology record at 10:30 AM.‚Äù

Ensures transparency & trust.

10. Performance Metrics & Compliance

System tracks:

Average access request time.

Number of successful vs failed attempts.

Policy enforcement efficiency.

Ensures HIPAA compliance and supports auditing for healthcare institutions.

üîπ End-to-End Flow (Summary)

Register ‚Üí Patient/Doctor registers with TTP oversight.

Authenticate ‚Üí JWT token issued for secure API usage.

Upload EHR ‚Üí Patient uploads EHR ‚Üí encrypted with per-file Fernet key.

Define Policies ‚Üí Patient sets granular, context-aware access rules.

Access Request ‚Üí Doctor requests access ‚Üí system validates JWT + policies.

Decrypt & Deliver ‚Üí If valid, decrypt file with Fernet key ‚Üí deliver securely.

Revocation ‚Üí TTP or Patient can revoke keys or policies at any time.

Logging ‚Üí All actions logged with timestamp, doctor, patient, status.

Notification ‚Üí Patient notified whenever doctor accesses their records.

Audit & Monitoring ‚Üí Logs + metrics ensure security, compliance, transparency.

üëâ This workflow ensures privacy, patient control, secure cryptography, transparency, and TTP oversight ‚Äî all in a scalable Flask + MongoDB + JWT system.

title: Social Media Analytics Dashboard
description:
The Social Media Dashboard Application is a centralized platform designed to track, analyze, and compare social media metrics across Instagram, YouTube, and LinkedIn. The goal of the application is to provide content creators, marketers, and businesses with a clear and minimal interface to monitor performance, compare platform statistics, and manage posting activities.

Users can view post activity, followers, likes, views, and engagement rates, as well as compare performance across all three platforms through visualized graphs. The app integrates with free APIs of the respective platforms, while authentication is managed securely through Firebase. All user and analytics data is stored in MongoDB, ensuring scalability and reliability.

The application has a fixed sidebar navigation, responsive design, and filtering options (by date or month) for all analytics. Additionally, users can personalize their experience via the Settings Page, where they can manage themes, API keys, and enabled platforms.

üìå Pages & Features Breakdown
1. Sidebar (Fixed Navigation ‚Äì visible across all pages)

Dashboard

Overview

Instagram

YouTube

LinkedIn

Settings

2. Dashboard Page

This is the central hub for the user.

Post Activity ‚Üí Shows recent post performance across all platforms.

Post Calendar ‚Üí Displays a calendar view of scheduled posts.

Top Trending Posts ‚Üí Highlights the best-performing posts (based on likes, views, engagement).

Most Active Social Media Platform ‚Üí Detects and displays which platform has the highest engagement.

Recent Activity Logs ‚Üí Timeline of recent updates (e.g., ‚ÄúNew post on Instagram reached 1K views‚Äù).

3. Overview Page

This page is for cross-platform comparison.

Comparison Graphs for Instagram, YouTube, and LinkedIn:

Likes (Date/Month filter)

Views (Date/Month filter)

Followers (Date/Month filter)

Sorting & Filtering ‚Üí Metrics can be sorted by daily or monthly trends.

Visualized with bar graphs, line charts, and pie charts for easy analysis.

4. Platform Pages (Individual for each platform)

Each platform gets its own dedicated page with the same structure but data sourced from its respective API.

a. Instagram Page

Post Activity (recent and scheduled posts)

Followers Count

Likes Count

Views Count

Engagement Rate

b. YouTube Page

Post/Video Activity

Subscribers Count

Likes Count

Views Count

Engagement Rate

c. LinkedIn Page

Post Activity

Followers Count

Likes/Reactions Count

Views Count

Engagement Rate

5. Settings Page

User personalization and configuration options.

Theme Switching (Light / Dark mode)

API Key Management (Add / Update API keys for Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn)

Social Media Enabler/Disabler (Toggle specific platforms on/off)

Log Out (Firebase authentication logout)

title: GloveCom
description:
Helping Hands ‚Äì Smart Sign Language Translation Glove
üîπ Overview

The Helping Hands Glove, designed and developed by Dhanushkumar Sekar, is a smart wearable device that translates sign language gestures into text and speech in real time.
It empowers individuals who are deaf and mute to communicate easily with the hearing community using an intuitive, technology-driven approach.

üîπ Hardware Description

The glove is embedded with five flex sensors (one per finger) and joysticks that detect the bending or movement of each finger.

An ESP32 microcontroller processes these sensor signals.

The ESP32 is equipped with Bluetooth for wireless data transmission.

Each unique finger movement combination corresponds to a specific sign or word.

üîπ Data Flow and Working

When a user performs a sign, the flex sensors and joysticks generate analog data.

This data is processed by the ESP32, which converts it into a digital gesture code.

The ESP32 sends the gesture code to the Helping Hands mobile app via Bluetooth communication.

The app receives the data, matches it with a trained gesture database, and displays the recognized sign as text.

Using Text-to-Speech (TTS) technology, the app converts the recognized word into speech output so that hearing individuals can understand it instantly.

üîπ Connection with the Helping Hands App

The Helping Hands app (built using React Native + Expo) connects to the glove using BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) via the react-native-ble-plx library.

Once paired, the app continuously listens for incoming data packets from the ESP32.

On receiving the data:

It maps the values to a pre-trained gesture dictionary (e.g., A‚ÄìZ, Hello, Thank You, Sorry, etc.).

The recognized text is displayed on-screen in a clean, readable UI.

The app speaks the text aloud using Expo Speech API for natural voice feedback.

üîπ Key Features

üß† Real-time gesture-to-speech translation.

üì∂ Wireless Bluetooth connection between glove and app.

üîä Text-to-Speech output for audible communication.

üì± Professional floating design and multi-page interface for accessibility.

üíæ Optional gesture customization ‚Äî users can train and save their own signs.

‚ö° Low power consumption via BLE communication.

üß© Future integration with emotion detection and facial expression tracking (for non-manual features).

üîπ Vision

The goal of Helping Hands is to bridge the communication gap between the hearing and speech-impaired communities using affordable assistive technology.
By combining IoT hardware (smart glove) with AI-powered mobile software, the system makes inclusive communication accessible to everyone.

Build a full-stack mobile application named Helping Hands, developed by Dhanushkumar Sekar.

üéØ App Objective

Helping Hands is a multi-page mobile app designed to assist users through intelligent features such as text-to-speech conversion, community support, and real-time assistance.

üì± Frontend Requirements (Expo React Native)

Use React Native with Expo.

Implement multiple screens (e.g., Home, Services, Voice Assistant, Profile, and About Us).

Include a floating action button (FAB) with professional, minimal animations for quick access to main features.

UI/UX Design:

Smooth navigation using react-navigation.

Use Tailwind CSS (nativewind) or Styled Components for modern, elegant design.

Include icons from Lucide-React or React Native Vector Icons.

Use Lottie animations for interactive and friendly visual effects.

Primary color theme: blue and white.

Include professional typography and spacing.

üîä Core Feature: Text-to-Speech

Convert any user-input text into speech using Expo Speech or react-native-tts.

Provide play, pause, and stop controls.

Display the spoken text on screen with a highlight animation.

‚öôÔ∏è Backend (Node.js + Express + MongoDB)

Build an API for user management (signup, login, profile update).

Add routes for saving user preferences (like voice speed, pitch, and saved messages).

Use MongoDB Atlas as the database.

Use JWT for authentication and bcrypt for password hashing.

Deploy backend on Render or Vercel.

‚òÅÔ∏è Additional Features

Include a help center/contact form that stores data in the backend.

Add speech history (user‚Äôs last 5 spoken texts).

Integrate BLE communication (optional future enhancement).

üì¶ Technical Stack

Frontend: Expo React Native (JavaScript)

Backend: Node.js + Express

Database: MongoDB Atlas

Authentication: JWT

Speech: Expo Speech API

üßë‚Äçüíª Developer Info

Created and developed by Dhanushkumar Sekar
Company: Helping Hands
Motto: ‚ÄúTechnology that speaks to help others.‚Äù

title: Quizpro AI
description:
Quizpro AI is a modern, full-stack web application designed to streamline the academic assessment process. It leverages the power of Google's Gemini API to dynamically generate unique, high-quality questions for quizzes and coding assessments, providing a secure and efficient platform for educational institutions.

The application features a complete, role-based architecture, a secure and interactive testing environment, and a consistent, attractive user interface.

## Key Features
AI-Powered Question Generation: Dynamically creates unique, current, and interview-style questions for any topic using the Google Gemini API. This ensures academic integrity by providing a fresh set of questions for each quiz instance.

Multi-Role Architecture: Secure, role-based access for four distinct user types, each with a dedicated dashboard and tailored permissions:

Professor: Can create new quizzes, view a list of all their created quizzes, and receive detailed reports on student performance.

Student: Can log in to a clean interface to view and take assigned quizzes and assessments.

HOD (Head of Department): Has oversight capabilities and receives consolidated reports.

Admin: Manages user accounts and can alter user roles.

Advanced Academic Integrity: The testing environment includes built-in security measures to discourage cheating, such as:

Copy-Paste Blocking: Disables copying and pasting during a test.

Focus-Loss Detection: If a student navigates away from the test page, the quiz is automatically refreshed with a new set of questions, and the violation is logged.

Smart Authentication and Authorization: Features a robust login system using JWTs. After logging in, the application automatically redirects users to their appropriate dashboard based on their role. API routes are protected to ensure only authorized users (e.g., only Professors) can perform specific actions.

Modern and Consistent UI: The entire application is wrapped in a consistent layout, featuring a "glassmorphism" design, a dynamic animated background, and a responsive navbar that adapts based on the user's login status.

## Technology Stack
Frontend: Next.js, React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS

Backend: Node.js, Express.js, TypeScript

Database: PostgreSQL with Prisma ORM for type-safe database access.

AI Engine: Google Gemini pro API

Architecture: Monorepo managed with Turborepo and npm workspaces

title: BiteTime
description:
Build/fix my existing app **"Canteen Buddy ‚Äì Smart Queue Prediction"** (currently preview shows only homepage; other pages are non-functional and UI is populated with Base44 sample/dummy data). Below are exact, non-ambiguous requirements‚Äîfollow them precisely and produce a working multi-page app bound to live data (Firebase). Do not leave placeholder static numbers or Base44 seeded data visible in the UI.

**Target:** Flutter frontend (or Base44 frontend) + Firebase backend + Cloud Functions for prediction logic.

---

## 1) Pages to implement (all must be functional)

* **Home** ‚Äî main landing page that explains the app, shows current crowd status, CTA buttons: *Check In Now*, *View Best Times*, *Survey*, and top-right *Login* / *Sign Up* buttons.
* **Survey** ‚Äî full survey page (also used as popup on first launch of the week) with the weekly questions.
* **Prediction** ‚Äî interactive graph/gauge showing live predictions (next 12 hrs), best time to visit, average wait.
* **Profile** ‚Äî student profile + participation history (survey history & check-ins).
* **Admin / Edit** ‚Äî admin-only UI to edit homepage text/images/components (WYSIWYG or editable fields) and to trigger a re-run of predictions.

---

## 2) Navigation & UI behavior

* **Top Bar**: Every page must show *Login* and *Sign Up* buttons on top-right.
* **Bottom Navigation Bar**: fixed bottom nav with icons/labels: `Home` | `Survey` | `Predictions` | `Profile`. Clicking should navigate to each page.
* **FAB**: Floating Action Button on the Home page labelled *Edit* (or pencil icon). Clicking FAB opens the **Admin / Edit** page ‚Äî only visible if user has `admin` role; otherwise show a tooltip or hide.
* **Animations & Styling**: Modern look ‚Äî gradient header, rounded cards, iconography for meals, slide/fade transitions between pages. (Design tokens fine to the platform.)

---

## 3) Weekly Survey logic

* On first app open of the week (per user), show a **survey popup** overlay (animated card). If user already answered within the past 7 days (check `users/{uid}.lastSurveyAt`), skip popup and open to Home directly.
* Survey questions (store full records in `surveys` collection):

  1. **How crowded is the canteen now?** (Options: Empty, Light, Medium, Crowded)
  2. **What order do you prefer now?** (Options as buttons with icons: Light Snack, Meals, Tiffin, Beverages, Others)
* Store each survey doc with:

  * `userId`, `canteenId`, `crowdLevel`, `mealPreference`, `timestamp`
* After submit: close popup and redirect to Home. Update `users/{uid}.lastSurveyAt = timestamp`.

---

## 4) Remove Base44 sample/dummy data & bind to live data

* **Do NOT display any seeded sample numbers or static dummy cards**. The UI must read from Firebase collections:

  * `checkins` (fields: `userId`, `canteenId`, `ts`)
  * `surveys` (fields: above)
  * `predictions` (see section 5)
  * `appConfig` (fields for homepage text/images editable by admin)
  * `users` (user profiles + `lastSurveyAt`, `roles`)
* If Base44 seeded objects exist, either **delete** them or set a query filter to ignore docs with `isSample=true`.
* Bind every visible metric (active users, wait time, meal popularity) to computed values from Firebase reads or Cloud Function results. If no data exists, show a neutral empty state with CTA: ‚ÄúNo live data yet ‚Äî take the survey‚Äù (do not show fake metrics).

---

## 5) Prediction logic & integration

* Implement a server-side callable function or scheduled job `/generatePredictions` (Cloud Function or platform cron):

  * Input: `canteenId`, look back window (e.g., last 7‚Äì14 days).
  * Algorithm: simple deterministic method acceptable (moving average per hour OR exponential smoothing). Example: calculate average check-ins per hour for last 7 days for each forthcoming hour ‚Üí save predicted counts.
  * Output: write a `predictions/{canteenId}` doc with:

    * `tsGenerated`, `predictions` (array of {hourStartISO, predictedCount}), `bestTime` (lowest predicted count), `peakTime` (highest predicted count), `avgWaitEstimate`.
* **Prediction page** should either:

  * Read the latest `predictions/{canteenId}` doc and display it as graph/gauge, OR
  * Call the callable function to compute on demand and show results.
* Prediction UI must update after each new `checkin` or on a scheduled re-run.

---

## 6) Check-In & Buttons functionality

* **Check In** button must create a `checkins` doc: `{ userId, canteenId, ts }`. After check-in, optionally update a lightweight counter via Cloud Function or transaction for `canteenStats/activeCount`.
* All buttons on Home and other pages must be fully wired to their actions (not show "page incomplete" error). If an action goes to another page, navigation must succeed.

---

## 7) Admin / Edit page

* Admin must be able to edit:

  * Homepage header text & subtitle
  * Hero image / illustration URL
  * Cards content (e.g., ‚ÄúHow it works‚Äù text, CTA labels)
* Save edits to `appConfig/home` doc. Home page must read from `appConfig/home` and reflect changes in the preview without requiring developer code edits.
* Protect admin page: only accessible when `users/{uid}.roles` contains `admin`.

---

## 8) Defaults & Empty States

* If the app has **no historical data**, do not show fake charts. Show:

  * ‚ÄúNot enough data yet ‚Äî help build it by taking a 1-minute survey‚Äù CTA.
* Provide clear loading and error states for network failures.

---

## 9) Security & Data model notes

* Use Firebase rules: only authenticated users can write `checkins`/`surveys`. Only admin role can update `appConfig`.
* Sanitize inputs and set rate limits (prevent spam surveys).

---

## 10) Acceptance tests (what I will check)

1. Launch app ‚Äî **Survey** popup appears ONCE if `lastSurveyAt` older than 7 days; otherwise skip.
2. Top-right **Login** and **Sign Up** buttons visible and functional.
3. Bottom navigation works: tapping `Prediction` shows the Prediction page and its graph/gauge.
4. Clicking **Check In** writes a real `checkins` doc in Firebase.
5. Prediction page reads from `predictions/{canteenId}` and shows actual numbers (not seeded data).
6. Admin FAB opens Edit page (only for admin), editing homepage updates `appConfig/home`, and changes reflect on Home page.
7. No seeded dummy numbers appear anywhere; when no data, neutral empty states/CTA shown.
8. Survey responses are saved in `surveys` with correct fields and timestamps.

---

## 11) Implementation hints for Base44 or developer

* Bind UI components to Firebase queries (not to static sample records).
* If Base44 auto-seeded sample records, either remove them or mark and ignore them using `isSample` field.
* Create a callable Cloud Function `/generatePredictions` and schedule it to run regularly; allow manual trigger in Admin.
* Use `users/{uid}.lastSurveyAt` and local storage fallback to implement weekly survey popup logic.
* For graphs, fetch `predictions.predictions` array and render hourly points.

---

### Final note (very important)

**Do not** leave the app with preview-only hardcoded sample numbers. The preview must reflect live data or show clear CTAs if there‚Äôs no data. After making changes, run the acceptance tests above and report back with exact locations of pages and any remaining console errors.

If you want, after this is applied I can provide the exact Firebase security rules, the Cloud Function pseudocode for `/generatePredictions`, and a short QA script to run through the acceptance tests.
additionalNotes:
Write a professional and engaging project description for an app called **BiteTime**.

**About the App**:
BiteTime is a smart canteen prediction app that helps students and staff avoid long queues and crowded timings. The app uses weekly survey inputs and AI-based predictions to estimate real-time crowd levels, waiting times, and the best times to visit the canteen.

**Key Features**:

* Homepage with live crowd status, estimated wait time, and active user count.
* Weekly survey popup (once per week) asking users about current crowd level and meal preferences (snacks, meals, tiffin, beverages).
* Prediction page with interactive graphs and best-time suggestions.
* Profile page with user info, participation history, and earned badges.
* Admin/Edit page for staff to update homepage text and images.
* Smooth navigation with bottom nav bar (Home, Survey, Prediction, Profile) and a floating edit button.
* Modern UI with gradient backgrounds, rounded cards, animations, and interactive graphs.
* Firebase backend to save survey data (User ID, answers, date & time) and AI predictions.

**Purpose**:
The goal of BiteTime is to make campus dining more efficient and stress-free by reducing waiting times and distributing crowd flow evenly throughout the day. It also helps canteen staff plan better and improve food service.

Make the description concise, clear, and appealing for project documentation and presentations.

title: Event Management
description:
**Situation**
A comprehensive event management platform for a college, designed to streamline event organization, registration, and management through a sophisticated web application with multi-tier user access and real-time database integration.

**Task**
Develop a full-stack web application that enables:
- Centralized event management
- Automated user creation
- Intelligent event registration system
- Real-time database management
- Responsive and AI-themed user interface

**Objective**
Create a robust, secure, and user-friendly event management ecosystem that:
- Simplifies event organization process
- Ensures fair and controlled student participation
- Provides comprehensive administrative controls
- Enhances college event management efficiency

**Knowledge**
Key System Components:
- Authentication Layers: Super Admin, Event Admin, Students
- JSON-based Configuration Management
- Real-time Database Integration
- Gmail Notification System
- Event Registration Logic
- Time-based Event Collision Prevention

Technical Requirements:
- Full-stack web application
- Responsive design
- AI-themed user interface
- Secure authentication mechanism
- Real-time database synchronization
- Automated user provisioning
- Event registration constraints

**Architectural Specifications**

1. Super Admin Capabilities:
- Create events via JSON configuration
- Automatically generate Event Admin credentials
- Automated Gmail credential dispatch
- Complete system-wide management access
- Comprehensive database visualization
- Student enrollment tracking
- Full administrative control

2. Event Admin Functionalities:
- Manage specific event registrations
- Modify event rules and regulations
- Configure support contact information
- JSON-based configuration management

3. Student Registration Mechanisms:
- One technical and one non-technical event registration
- Intelligent time-slot collision prevention
- Real-time event availability tracking

4. Technical Architecture:
- Microservices-based backend
- GraphQL/REST API integration
- WebSocket for real-time updates
- JWT-based authentication
- OAuth 2.0 for secure access

5. Database Requirements:
- Real-time synchronization
- Scalable NoSQL database (Firebase/MongoDB)
- Comprehensive data integrity checks
- Automated backup mechanisms

6. Security Protocols:
- Role-based access control
- Multi-factor authentication
- Encrypted credential storage
- Regular security audits
- GDPR and data protection compliance

7. User Experience Design:
- AI-inspired responsive interface
- Dark/Light mode support
- Intuitive navigation
- Micro-interactions
- Accessibility compliance

**Recommended Technology Stack**:
- Frontend: React.js/Next.js
- Backend: Node.js/Express
- Database: Firebase Realtime Database
- Authentication: Firebase Authentication
- Hosting: Firebase/Vercel
- Email Service: Nodemailer/SendGrid
- State Management: Redux/Context API

**Implementation Strategy**:
1. Modular microservices architecture
2. Comprehensive error handling
3. Scalable design patterns
4. Continuous integration/deployment
5. Performance optimization techniques

**Example Configuration**:
```json
{
  "eventType": "Technical Symposium",
  "eventAdmin": {
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "johndoe@college.edu"
  },
  "timeSlots": [
    {
      "start": "2024-03-15T10:00:00Z",
      "end": "2024-03-15T12:00:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "registrationRules": {
    "maxParticipants": 100,
    "eligibilityCriteria": "PG Students"
  }
}
```

title: TV application React Native
description:
# OTT TV App ‚Äî React Native scaffold & starter plan

This document contains a runnable plan, recommended tech stack, UX guidelines for TV, a proposed folder structure, essential features, and starter code snippets (Home screen, Detail screen, Video player) to get your OTT TV application built with React Native.

---

## 1) Project overview

Build an Over-The-Top (OTT) TV application that runs on Android TV and tvOS (Apple TV) using React Native. Key requirements typically include:

* Browse catalogs (movies, series, shorts)
* Search and categories
* Detail pages with metadata and trailer
* HLS streaming with adaptive bitrate
* DRM support (Widevine on Android, FairPlay on tvOS) ‚Äî later step
* Authentication and subscriptions
* Remote (D-pad) friendly navigation and focus management
* Leanback-style UI with large artwork and rows of content

---

## 2) Recommended tech stack

* **Frontend**: React Native (supports tvOS & Android TV) using the official React Native package that supports tv platforms.
* **Navigation**: `react-navigation` (works on TV) + focusable components
* **Video player**: `react-native-video` for HLS playback (works with ExoPlayer on Android, AVPlayer on iOS/tvOS)
* **Focus management**: use built-in `useTVEventHandler` + `TVFocusGuide` patterns. Optionally `react-native-tvfocusable` or `react-native-tvos-controller` utilities if you want helpers.
* **State management**: Context + `react-query` (or RTK Query) for server data fetching and caching
* **Auth**: OAuth/JWT with backend endpoints
* **Backend**: Node.js + Express or Fastify (GraphQL optional). Media served via CDN supporting HLS (CloudFront, Fastly) and DRM via a packager (Shaka, BuyDRM, MUX DRM, or CDN-managed DRM).
* **Storage**: Postgres for metadata, Redis for sessions/caching
* **CI/CD**: GitHub Actions, EAS (Expo Application Services) or Fastlane for building tvOS/Android TV artifacts

---

## 3) UX & Accessibility (TV-specific)

* Use large tappable areas and clear focus states (outline + scale + elevation).
* Remote navigation: D-pad left/right/up/down + play/pause buttons.
* Avoid text input where possible; if search is required, provide on-screen keyboard or voice input.
* Focus order must be deterministic ‚Äî design a grid/row layout similar to Leanback.
* Minimum safe tap area: 48‚Äì64 dp.
* Keep icons and text legible at typical viewing distance.

---

## 4) Core features (MVP)

1. Home screen with rows (Carousels) of content
2. Detail screen with metadata and play/trailer buttons
3. Secure HLS playback (tokenized manifest URLs for basic protection)
4. Authentication and user profile
5. Category filtering and search
6. Favorites / watchlist
7. Player with resume-from-last-position and basic controls

---

## 5) Folder structure (suggested)

```
my-ott-tv/
‚îú‚îÄ app/                      # RN app entry (if using expo or plain RN)
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ components/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ CarouselRow.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ FocusableCard.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ Header.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ screens/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ HomeScreen.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ DetailScreen.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ PlayerScreen.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ navigation/
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ index.tsx
‚îÇ  ‚îú‚îÄ hooks/
‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ services/
‚îÇ     ‚îî‚îÄ api.ts
‚îú‚îÄ server/                   # simple metadata + auth service
‚îú‚îÄ infra/                    # deployment scripts, drm integration notes
‚îî‚îÄ package.json
```

---

## 6) Starter code snippets

> Note: these are minimal examples meant to run as starting points. They use TypeScript-like syntax but you can adapt to JS.

### FocusableCard component (key for remote navigation)

```tsx
import React from 'react';
import { View, Text, Image, Pressable } from 'react-native';

export default function FocusableCard({ title, poster, onPress, isFocused }) {
  return (
    <Pressable onPress={onPress} style={({ pressed }) => ({
      margin: 8,
      transform: [{ scale: pressed || isFocused ? 1.06 : 1 }],
      shadowOpacity: pressed || isFocused ? 0.35 : 0,
    })}>
      <Image source={{ uri: poster }} style={{ width: 320, height: 180, borderRadius: 8 }} />
      <Text numberOfLines={1} style={{ marginTop: 8, width: 320 }}>{title}</Text>
    </Pressable>
  );
}
```

### HomeScreen (rows of focusable items)

```tsx
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import { View, Text, FlatList } from 'react-native';
import FocusableCard from '../components/FocusableCard';

export default function HomeScreen({ navigation }) {
  const [rows] = useState([ /* your rows data from API */ ]);

  return (
    <View style={{ flex: 1, backgroundColor: '#000' }}>
      <Text style={{ fontSize: 38, margin: 16, color: '#fff' }}>Featured</Text>
      <FlatList
        horizontal
        data={rows[0].items}
        keyExtractor={i => i.id}
        renderItem={({ item }) => (
          <FocusableCard
            title={item.title}
            poster={item.poster}
            onPress={() => navigation.navigate('Detail', { id: item.id })}
          />
        )}
      />
    </View>
  );
}
```

### PlayerScreen (react-native-video example)

```tsx
import React, { useRef } from 'react';
import { View } from 'react-native';
import Video from 'react-native-video';

export default function PlayerScreen({ route }) {
  const playerRef = useRef(null);
  const { hlsUrl } = route.params;

  return (
    <View style={{ flex: 1, backgroundColor: '#000' }}>
      <Video
        ref={playerRef}
        source={{ uri: hlsUrl }}
        style={{ flex: 1 }}
        controls
        resizeMode="contain"
        onError={(e) => console.error('video error', e)}
      />
    </View>
  );
}
```

---

## 7) Backend & streaming notes

* Serve HLS manifests (.m3u8) via CDN. Use short-lived signed URLs to protect manifests.
* For DRM: integrate a packager and license server for Widevine (Android) and FairPlay (Apple). This is complex and usually handled by a third-party packager or CDN.
* Implement resume and offline position storing in your backend or local storage.

---

## 8) Development & testing tips

* Test on actual devices (Android TV emulator is okay but test on real Android TV box and Apple TV).
* Use tvOS simulator for initial UI testing.
* Use `adb` remote control or simulator's remote to test D-pad navigation.
* Log focus events and ensure focus flows correctly.

---

## 9) Next steps I can help with (choose any)

* Generate a runnable starter repo (React Native + sample screens + video player) ‚Äî I can scaffold it.
* Create production-ready PlayerScreen with resume, DRM stub, and analytics hooks.
* Design home-screen UI (mockups) and provide pixel-perfect component code.
* Backend API spec for metadata, auth, subscriptions, and tokenized HLS URLs.

Tell me which next step you'd like and I'll continue.

---

*End of document.*
additionalNotes: This document contains a runnable plan, recommended tech stack, UX guidelines for TV, a proposed folder structure, essential features, and starter code snippets (Home screen, Detail screen, Video player) to get your OTT TV application built with React Native.

title: One Point
description:
The E-Commerce & Retail Management System is a web-based application designed to connect customers and retailers on a single digital platform. The main objective of the project is to provide an easy, secure, and efficient online shopping experience while helping retailers manage their products, sales, and inventory digitally.

This system allows customers to browse products, add items to cart, place orders, and make online payments. Retailers can upload products, manage stock, view sales reports, and update prices in real time. The admin manages the entire system ‚Äî handling user accounts, retailer approvals, and order tracking.

The platform supports multiple categories, a user-friendly interface, and secure transactions. It also includes features such as search and filter, order history, notifications, and customer reviews to enhance the overall user experience.


---

Key Features:

1. User Module: Registration, Login, Browse Products, Add to Cart, Place Orders.


2. Retailer Module: Add/Edit Products, Manage Inventory, View Sales Reports.


3. Admin Module: Manage Users, Approve Retailers, Monitor Orders.


4. Search & Filter: Easy product search by name, category, or price.


5. Payment Gateway: Secure online payment integration.


6. Order Tracking: Real-time status updates for orders.


7. Customer Feedback: Ratings and reviews for products.

title: AI-POWERED PLAGIARISM DETECTION SYSTEM
description:
The AI-Powered Plagiarism Detection System is an advanced web-based solution designed to ensure academic and professional integrity through intelligent plagiarism analysis. Built with a modern purple and white themed user interface, the system offers a clean, responsive, and mobile-friendly experience with smooth navigation and accessibility.

The platform utilizes Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to analyze documents, detect paraphrased content, and compare submissions against both local databases and online repositories. By moving beyond basic string matching, the system applies advanced algorithms such as Cosine Similarity, TF-IDF, and semantic analysis, ensuring accurate identification of both direct and rephrased plagiarism.

Key functionalities include multi-format file support (PDF, DOCX, PPTX, TXT, ZIP), real-time text preprocessing (case normalization, stopword removal, special character filtering), and optimized performance through indexing and caching for large file handling. Users receive interactive plagiarism reports that feature percentage scores, highlighted similarities, referenced source links, and downloadable reports in PDF, Word, and Text formats.

To provide structured access, the system incorporates role-based authentication with dedicated dashboards for Admins, Teachers, and Students. The Admin Panel supports user management, system monitoring, activity logging, and analytics. Additional features include cloud storage integration, document history tracking, grammar and citation checking, and paraphrasing suggestions to guide originality improvement.

Security is a core priority, with encrypted file uploads, HTTPS communication, and GDPR compliance ensuring safe handling of sensitive user data. The modular design includes the User Authentication Module, Document Upload & Preprocessing Module, Database Comparison Module, Similarity Scoring Module, Report Generation Module, and Admin Dashboard Module, creating a robust and scalable framework.

Overall, this project delivers a comprehensive, intelligent, and secure plagiarism detection solution that combines cutting-edge AI techniques with a professional, user-centric design‚Äîempowering students, researchers, and professionals to maintain originality with confidence.
additionalNotes:
The system emphasizes usability and accessibility, offering a clean UI/UX with a matte purple & white theme suitable for both desktop and mobile devices.

AI + NLP algorithms enable detection of direct matches, paraphrasing, and semantic similarities, providing higher accuracy than traditional plagiarism checkers.

Supports multi-format uploads (PDF, DOCX, PPTX, TXT, ZIP) with secure file encryption and compliance with GDPR standards.

Includes role-based authentication for Admin, Teacher, and Student dashboards, each tailored with distinct privileges and features.

Admin panel features user management, analytics, and activity logs for effective monitoring and control.

Generates interactive plagiarism reports with percentage scores, highlighted sections, reference links, and options to download in multiple formats (PDF/Word/Text).

Optimized for large file handling with indexing and caching to maintain system speed and efficiency.

Enhanced with extra tools such as paraphrasing suggestions, grammar checking, and citation validation for improving content quality.

Designed to be scalable and secure, suitable for academic institutions, research organizations, and professional environments.

title: Secure Attendance Management System
description:
I am building a **College Students Management System** using **React/Next.js (TSX)** and **Supabase**. I require a complete, integrated solution for Authentication and the new Attendance Management System.

Generate the following comprehensive solution in four parts:

---

### **Part 1: Foundational Authentication & RLS**

1.  **Supabase Auth Setup:** Provide the necessary **SQL statement** to enable the **`auth` extension** and confirm that **Row Level Security (RLS)** is enabled on the necessary tables (like `profiles`).
2.  **TSX Login Component:** Create a complete, functional **React TSX component** named `LoginOrSignUpForm`. This component must handle:
    * State management for `email`, `password`, and error messages.
    * **Sign Up** and **Sign In** functionality using `supabase.auth.signInWithPassword` and `supabase.auth.signUp`.

---

### **Part 2: Attendance Database Schema**

1.  Create the **SQL schema** for two new core tables. Assume existing tables are `students` and `courses`.
    * **`classes`**: To store details about each class. Include `id` (PK), `course_id` (FK to `courses`), `class_name` (text), and `instructor_id` (FK to Supabase `auth.users`).
    * **`attendance_records`**: The main transactional table to log attendance. It must include:
        * `id` (PK, unique identifier)
        * **`student_id`** (FK to `students` table)
        * **`class_id`** (FK to the `classes` table)
        * **`record_date`** (Date)
        * **`status`** (Text, constrained by a CHECK constraint to values like 'Present', 'Absent', 'Late', 'Excused').
        * A **UNIQUE constraint** across `student_id`, `class_id`, and `record_date` to prevent duplicate entries.

---

### **Part 3: Advanced RLS Policies for Attendance**

Write the complete **SQL policies** for the **`attendance_records` table** to enforce the following security rules:

1.  **Policy for Management (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE):** The policy must ensure that **only authenticated users who are instructors or admins** (which can be checked via the `auth.uid()` function) can **INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE** records.
2.  **Policy for Students (SELECT):** Students (general authenticated users) should only be able to **SELECT** (read) records that are linked to **their own `student_id`** to view their personal attendance history. (Assume there is a mapping table or column linking the `auth.uid()` to the `student_id`).

---

### **Part 4: TSX Attendance Entry Component**

1.  Provide the necessary **TypeScript interfaces** for an `AttendanceEntry` object and a `StudentProfile` object.
2.  Create a highly efficient **React TSX component** called `AttendanceEntryGrid` designed for an **instructor** to quickly mark attendance for an entire class.
3.  The component must simulate:
    * Fetching a list of all students for a specific `class_id`.
    * Using a state variable to track the attendance status of each student in the grid.
4.  Show the structure of the single **`handleSubmit` function** that uses the authenticated Supabase client to efficiently **batch insert** all new attendance records (an array of objects) into the `attendance_records` table in a single request using the `insert` method.
additionalNotes:

title: greenhouse_dashboard
description:
Build a React dashboard using Vite + React + shadcn/ui that simulates a digital greenhouse environment. The dashboard should include the following features:

Live Gauges for Sensor Factors

Temperature (¬∞C)

Humidity (%)

CO‚ÇÇ (ppm)

Soil Moisture (%)

Light (lux)

Ventilation (%)

Nutrient EC & pH

Gauges should be color-coded based on thresholds (Green = safe, Yellow = caution, Red = critical)

Trend Charts

Show trends for all 7 factors over time

Use Recharts or similar library

Responsive, scrollable, color-coded lines

Action Timeline Panel

Logs actions taken by the system (ventilation, irrigation, lighting)

Shows timestamp + description + reason

Control Panel

Manual override for Vent, Irrigation, CO‚ÇÇ dosing, Lighting, Fertilization

Use sliders, toggles, or range inputs

Updates the simulator in real-time

Alerts Panel

Highlights critical conditions (e.g., temperature too high, humidity too low, pH out of range)

Uses badges or colored cards for warnings

End-of-Run Report Panel (Optional)

Summarizes water usage, average temperature/humidity, CO‚ÇÇ & fertilizer used, alerts triggered

Functional Requirements:

Data comes from a simulated greenhouse environment (randomized within realistic bounds)

Dashboard should be fully modular: separate components for gauges, charts, timeline, controls, alerts

Integrate with WebSocket or API to receive real-time data from a Python backend

Explainable actions: each logged action should show the reason it was taken

Styling:

Use shadcn/ui components (Card, CardHeader, CardContent, CardTitle, Badge)

Responsive grid layout

Soft shadows, 2xl rounded corners

Color-coded indicators for safety levels

Output:

Complete React component structure (App.jsx + reusable components)

Live updating simulation of sensor data

Trend charts, timeline, control panel, alerts fully working
additionalNotes: use React.js and javascript for functionalities and python for backend stuff

title: ACE Invitation Manager
description:
ACE Invitation Manager is a web application tailored for managing an e-invitation business. The system enables the business owner to store customer details, including name, phone number, invitation type (e-invitation or video invitation), price, and related links (invitation URL, Canva link, Google Drive link for videos).

The platform also includes a dashboard for monthly sales tracking and expense management. Business costs such as hosting fees and Canva subscription are recorded, allowing automatic calculation of revenue, expenses, and net profit.

By combining customer management, sales insights, and expense tracking, ACE Invitation Manager simplifies operations and provides a clear overview of business performance.

Key Features:

Manage customer details and invitation records.

Support for both e-invitation and video invitation types.

Store links for Canva designs and Google Drive videos.

Dashboard with monthly sales, expenses, and profit analytics.

Expense tracking for hosting and Canva subscription.
