title: Yogii-Tech E-Hub
description:
We‚Äôre designing a modular, micro-service-driven Learning Management & Certification Platform (LMS+) with:

Multi-role access (Admin / Instructor / Student / Guest)

Modular course hierarchy (Course ‚Üí Module ‚Üí Lesson)

Video storage & secure playback

Automated certificate generation with QR-based verification

Admin analytics & progress tracking

Scalable deployment & CI/CD

üß± 2. ARCHITECTURE STACK (TOP-TIER)
Layer	Technology	Purpose
Frontend	Next.js (React 19) + Tailwind CSS	Server-Side Rendering for SEO, blazing fast UX, mobile-first
Backend API	NestJS (Node.js)	Modular architecture, TypeScript strong typing, testability
Database	PostgreSQL	Relational schema for user-course-certificate relationships
ORM	Prisma	Type-safe DB layer, easy migrations
Auth	JWT + Refresh Tokens (or Auth0)	Secure, scalable, supports multiple user roles
Storage	AWS S3 + CloudFront CDN	Secure video uploads, streaming optimization
Background Jobs	Redis + BullMQ	Handle async tasks (certificate gen, email send)
Certificate Generation	Puppeteer / PDFKit + qrcode	Generate branded PDFs with embedded QR links
Emails / Notifications	SendGrid / AWS SES	Transactional & onboarding mails
Deployment	Docker + Kubernetes / AWS ECS	Auto-scaling & containerized microservices
Monitoring	Grafana + Prometheus + Sentry	Performance + error tracking
CI/CD	GitHub Actions	Automated testing, build & deployment
üß© 3. MODULE-WISE FUNCTIONAL STRUCTURE

Below is a breakdown of all the major functional modules, like a CTO would plan during the discovery phase.

üéì A. User & Role Management

Purpose: Authentication, authorization, and user control.

Entities

Admin

Instructor

Student

Guest (read-only)

Features

Signup/Login (Email + Password / OAuth)

JWT-based access tokens

Role-based access control (RBAC)

Profile management (bio, avatar, contact info)

Password reset / email verification

Optional: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)

üìö B. Course Management Module
Hierarchy

Course ‚Üí Module ‚Üí Lesson

Level	Description
Course	Top-level container (e.g., ‚ÄúSystemVerilog Masterclass‚Äù)
Module	Subtopic grouping (e.g., ‚ÄúUVM Testbench Basics‚Äù)
Lesson	Individual units (video, PDF, quiz)
Features

Create / edit / delete courses

Upload course thumbnail, description, tags, difficulty

Attach multiple modules and lessons

Set visibility (public / private / paid)

Auto-generated course slug (SEO-friendly)

‚ÄúDrip‚Äù scheduling (unlock next module on date or completion)

Lesson types:

Video (from AWS S3 / Vimeo)

Document / PDF

Quiz / Assignment

Discussion board

üé• C. Video Management Module
Architecture

Videos stored securely in AWS S3

Distributed via CloudFront CDN

URLs are signed per user session (to prevent sharing)

Optional: integrate Mux or Vimeo Pro for analytics

Features

Upload interface for admin/instructors

Auto video transcoding (multiple resolutions)

Resume playback functionality

Progress sync (e.g., ‚ÄúWatched 83%‚Äù)

Video player analytics (start, stop, pause, watch time)

üßë‚Äçüéì D. Student Dashboard

Dashboard Widgets:

Active Courses

% Completion per course

Time spent / total lessons watched

Earned certificates

Recent announcements

Suggested next courses

Interactions

Continue learning from last module

Download resources

Track completion badges

See certificate eligibility status

Post questions / comments in course forums

üßë‚Äçüíº E. Admin Dashboard

Core Panels:

Overview: total students, courses, completion rate

Course analytics: top courses, average completion

Certificate analytics: issued, verified, revoked

Revenue (if monetization enabled)

System logs (errors, login attempts)

Management Features

CRUD for users/courses

Manual certificate creation/revocation

Bulk import/export of users via CSV

Content moderation (flag inappropriate content)

ü™™ F. Certificate Management System
Flow

Student completes all required lessons.

Backend triggers certificate generation job ‚Üí pushes to Redis queue.

Worker picks job ‚Üí generates unique ID & QR code.

Certificate template (HTML) is rendered into PDF via Puppeteer.

File stored on S3 ‚Üí DB updated ‚Üí Email sent to student.

Certificate Fields

Student name

Course title

Completion date

Certificate ID (UUID or hash)

QR code linking to verification page

Signatures (auto from admin)

Verification

Public endpoint:

https://yourdomain.com/verify/<certificate_code>


Displays verification result:

{
  "valid": true,
  "issued_to": "Yogii Kumar",
  "course": "UVM Masterclass",
  "issued_on": "2025-10-19"
}


Optional Blockchain Verification:

Hash certificate data (sha256) and store on Polygon testnet.

Verify immutably via blockchain viewer.

üßæ G. Notification & Communication System

Email confirmation (SendGrid / SES)

Push notifications (Firebase)

Course-related announcements

Certificate issued alerts

In-platform messaging between instructor & student

üß† H. Analytics & Reporting

For Admins:

Learner activity graph (daily/weekly/monthly)

Top 5 courses by engagement

Certificate verification counts

Drop-off analysis (module watch %)

Export reports (CSV / Excel / PDF)

For Students:

Personal progress insights

Time-based performance graph

üí∞ I. Payment & Monetization (Phase 2)

Payment gateway integration (Stripe / Razorpay)

Subscription tiers or one-time purchase

Coupon / discount management

Invoices + payment logs

Access control post-payment

üí¨ J. Discussion & Community (Optional)

Course-specific discussion boards

Q&A threads per lesson

Instructor replies

Notification when someone replies to your question

üß© 4. DATABASE SCHEMA (DETAILED SNAPSHOT)
-- Users Table
users(
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  full_name VARCHAR(100),
  email VARCHAR(150) UNIQUE,
  password_hash TEXT,
  role ENUM('admin','instructor','student'),
  avatar TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Courses
courses(
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  title VARCHAR(200),
  description TEXT,
  category VARCHAR(100),
  difficulty ENUM('beginner','intermediate','advanced'),
  thumbnail_url TEXT,
  created_by INT REFERENCES users(id),
  status ENUM('active','draft'),
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Modules
modules(
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  course_id INT REFERENCES courses(id),
  title VARCHAR(150),
  order_index INT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Lessons
lessons(
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  module_id INT REFERENCES modules(id),
  title VARCHAR(150),
  lesson_type ENUM('video','document','quiz'),
  content_url TEXT,
  duration INT,
  order_index INT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Progress Tracking
progress(
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT REFERENCES users(id),
  lesson_id INT REFERENCES lessons(id),
  completed BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
  completed_at TIMESTAMP
);

-- Certificates
certificates(
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT REFERENCES users(id),
  course_id INT REFERENCES courses(id),
  certificate_code VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
  pdf_url TEXT,
  issue_date DATE,
  status ENUM('valid','revoked'),
  verification_count INT DEFAULT 0
);

üß© 5. FRONTEND STRUCTURE (Next.js Directory Map)
src/
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ layout.tsx
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ page.tsx (Landing)
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ login/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ register/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dashboard/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ student/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ admin/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ instructor/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ courses/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ [courseId]/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.tsx (Course overview)
 ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ    ‚îÇ    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ module/[moduleId].tsx (Lesson player)
 ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ verify/[certificateCode]/page.tsx (Verification)
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Navbar.tsx
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sidebar.tsx
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ VideoPlayer.tsx
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CertificatePreview.tsx
 ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ProgressBar.tsx
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ lib/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ api.ts (Axios instance)
 ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ auth.ts (Token helpers)
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles/
 ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ globals.css

üß© 6. BACKEND MODULE STRUCTURE (NestJS)
src/
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main.ts
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ app.module.ts
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ auth/
 ‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ auth.controller.ts
 ‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ auth.service.ts
 ‚îÇ    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ jwt.strategy.ts
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ users/
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ courses/
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ modules/
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ lessons/
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ progress/
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ certificates/
 ‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ certificates.service.ts
 ‚îÇ    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ certificates.controller.ts
 ‚îÇ    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ certificate-worker.ts (BullMQ job)
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ notifications/
 ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ analytics/
 ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ utils/

üß© 7. DEPLOYMENT PIPELINE (CI/CD)
Flow

Code pushed to main branch.

GitHub Actions runs:

Lint + tests (Jest)

Build Docker image

Image pushed to AWS ECR

Deploy to ECS Fargate / Kubernetes cluster

Database migrations via Prisma

Health checks + alerts via Grafana

üß© 8. SECURITY & COMPLIANCE
Concern	Implementation
Authentication	JWT w/ refresh tokens
Authorization	Role-based guards
HTTPS	Cloudflare or AWS ALB
Data Encryption	AES-256 for sensitive data
Input Validation	Class-Validator decorators
Rate Limiting	API throttling via Nginx
Backup	Daily RDS snapshot + S3 replication
GDPR Compliance	Data export & deletion endpoint
üß© 9. SCALABILITY STRATEGY

Stateless micro-services for horizontal scaling.

Separate media storage (S3) and database layer (RDS).

Load balancing via AWS ALB.

Redis for caching & queue management.

Option to shard database if user base grows.

üß© 10. FUTURE ENHANCEMENTS (ROADMAP)
Phase	Feature	Description
2.0	Mobile App	React Native / Flutter wrapper
2.0	AI Recommendation	Suggest next courses based on learning history
2.0	Gamification	Badges, leaderboard, XP system
2.1	Multi-language	i18n support
2.2	Organization Accounts	Team-based learning

2.4	Blockchain Certificates	Immutable proof for issued certs

title: CULTIVATOR
description:
"Design a professional, responsive, and user-friendly AI-powered Crop Yield Prediction and Optimization website for India, following the look and feel of Indian government agriculture portals. The website should:

Display real-time weather forecasts and agricultural parameters using Open-Meteo (free, India-compatible, no API key required).

Support multi-language content (Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, etc.) using LibreTranslate (free, open-source).

Show soil health, moisture, and crop status using satellite data from AgroMonitoring (free tier).

Automatically detect the user‚Äôs location (latitude/longitude) using the browser‚Äôs Geolocation API.

Include an AI-powered chatbot built with Rasa to assist farmers, answer queries, and provide personalized recommendations.

Use AI to predict crop yield and recommend optimal farming practices based on weather, soil data, and location.

Follow a clean, professional design inspired by Indian government websites: simple navigation, clear typography, accessible layouts, and visually highlighted actionable insights for farmers.

The goal is a reliable, trustworthy platform that helps Indian farmers make data-driven decisions efficiently and easily."

title: restuarnt_partner
description: Developed a Restaurant Partner App that enables restaurant owners to receive real-time order notifications through Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM). Implemented both in-app notification modals for foreground alerts and background services to handle notifications even when the app is closed. The system ensures seamless order updates with sound alerts, efficient message handling, and enhanced user experience for restaurant partners managing live orders.

title: connectsphere
description:
ConnectSphere: A hybrid video conferencing app (iOS, Android, web) with AI-driven real-time translation and text-to-ASL video generation for inclusive communication.
Built with Bolt, it offers a modern, premium, accessible UI, targeting global teams and hearing-impaired users.
additionalNotes:
Requirements: Hybrid app (iOS, Android, web) using Bolt, with WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility, supporting 10+ languages and ASL/BSL, with a modern, premium navy/teal UI.
Features: HD video calls for 50+ users with screen sharing, real-time translation, text-to-ASL video generation, and responsive, multilingual interface.

title: ai extension
description:
A browser extension that connects with Google Gemini API. 
 
When students highlight a word/sentence ‚Üí a popup appears with an AI
powered explanation (like definitions, summaries, or examples). 
 
It works on any website, PDF, or article, making learning seamless. 
 
Why It‚Äôs Useful for Students 
 
No need to Google/search separately ‚Üí instant learning. 
 
Helps in reading research papers, textbooks, or complex articles. 
 
Can give simplified explanations in student-friendly language. 
 
Supports multiple subjects (science, coding, history, etc.). 
 
Possible Features to Add 
 
     Multiple explanation modes: ‚ÄúSimple‚Äù, ‚ÄúDetailed‚Äù, or ‚ÄúExample-based‚Äù. 
 
   Language translation (highlight + translate instantly). 
 
          Note saver: Option to save explanations into Notion/Docs. 
 
    Text-to-speech: Read aloud explanations for better accessibility. 
 
       Exam mode: Summarize only key points, like flashcards. 
 
Unique Differentiation Features 
 
Multiple Explanation Modes 
 
Simple (1‚Äì2 lines for quick learning). 
 
Detailed (with examples, formulas, or step-by-step logic). 
 
Analogy Mode (explain like a story or real-world comparison). 
 
Student-Centric Add-ons 
 
Highlight ‚Üí Save as Note (directly into Notion/Google Docs). 
 
Highlight ‚Üí Generate Flashcard (Q&A style for exam prep). 
 
Highlight ‚Üí Create Quiz Question (MCQ or short answer). 
 
Subject-Specific Explanations 
 
If text is a math problem ‚Üí show step-by-step solution. 
 
If it‚Äôs coding ‚Üí explain code line-by-line. 
 
If it‚Äôs history/literature ‚Üí summarize key events/themes. 
 
Personalization 
 
Track what a student highlights most ‚Üí give personalized study insights. 
 
Let users choose tone: Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced. 
 
Accessibility Edge 
 
      Text-to-speech for audio learners. 
 
   Instant translation into chosen language (Tamil, Hindi, etc.). 
 
        How This Stands Out 
 
Google Dictionary ‚Üí only meanings. 
 
ChatGPT extensions ‚Üí generic answers.
